text: Ate here with the Bros. Cheap menu....dagum good breakfast. Good weather. They had EPL [English Premier League] which was dope. I gave it four stars because they don't have bottomless mimosas. Bring pappy a bottomless mimosa and I'll add the extra star amigo!

When asking locals "where is the best place to eat?" We weren't expecting to get directed to this hole-in-the-wall little joint. With flashiness all around, we would have easily overlooked the little black door tucked away into the building. When we walked in, the ambiance was artsy, the drink specials were awesome, and the menu was to the point and full of goodness.  I got the Market Steak sandwich (YES. It is AMAZING.) With Chili-Mac on the side. You will think that it's just macaroni and cheese, but the way they make the noodles al-dente and have such a buttery cheese sauce with perfect chili... you cannot pass it up. Don't fall for the gimmicks of murals and colors... this may look like a plain little section of NoDa but it was a highlight of my trip. I will be back.

If I could rate less than a one, I would! My first time here. I was a solo diner so I sat at the bar. The bartender tells me that I cannot order any food for 30 minutes. I went there for breakfast. They are clearly still making breakfast in the kitchen as I can see the cooks. I understand the transition to lunch but to sit and can't order any food for 30 minutes is ridiculous! Spoke to the manger about it and  she asserts breakfast ends at 12:59. Yeah ok, so I should have been literally 30 seconds earlier.  All I wanted to do was sit down,  drink a mimosa and eat a scrambled egg... I guess 30 seconds eliminated that's possibility. (The rules are the rules). Just wish that had it posted on their website that you must be there by 12:59 to get breakfast. Never again!

Divey locals bar in a cute little village area. Bartender and patrons super friendly! Lots of beer choices! BURGERS EXCELLENT!!! A must try! The chili was very good with a small kick to it. Highly recommend!!

Never Again...

Not a busy Saturday afternoon, and after an hour of waiting for our food, the server magically realized the kitchen "lost our ticket".  

I am not someone that would have waited an hour to say something, but after taking our order we did not have the server bother to stop at the table to ask if I wanted another beer or even refill a water glass.  In fact, we never even got a refill on the water never mind a second beer. 

I would have gone as far to ask to speak to the manager but she was too busy dancing around the back door eating her food after the server pointed at my table to tell her what had happened.

Needless to say, I was not surprised when the check came and nothing was adjusted to reflect the experience...

Solid menu, interesting people watching. Kinda wish I'd had an easier time getting the attention of the wait staff, but, eh: Friday in NoDa - what are you gonna do? Suck it up, buttercup -they're cooler than you anyhow. 

I will say the turf & turf burger was damned good, though. Mmmm!
We had breakfast at Jack's this morning and it was terrific. The biscuits and gravy were the best I've ever had in North Carolina!

My girlfriend and I went to Jack Beagles this weekend. I've lived in Charlotte for 6 years and this was the first time I'd come here for breakfast, instead of a late-night brew. I got the sh!t.... basically steak on toast. So freaking good. Whoever said it was acceptable to eat steak for breakfast was a smart person.

I was strolling around NoDa after some meetings and was looking to cop a hearty lunch with a cold adult beverage. I walked into Jack Beagles and sat at the bar. It was a very inviting atmosphere and the staff was friendly. As I checked out the menu, I noticed that they gave many of the dishes colorful nicknames. I thought to myself, this concept can either create a local legend or go horribly awry. At that very moment, I saw a cheesesteak they offered called "the stugots", which is Italian slang for a variation of "stu cazz" or "stu cazzo" i.e. "My d**k" or "my balls", or "my d**k AND my balls"; terms used interchangeably to express ones defiance or disbelief in something or someone (courtesy translation for the ethnically challenged). Needless to say, I had the cajones to order the stugots. I asked the chef to add green peppers as they were not listed in the menu description. He balked at the idea for a second, but then threw a few on the grill with the onions, steak and pepperoni as per my request. The result...boom. It kicked off like a loose forward. I have since drastically reduced the amount of red meat in my diet. If you are likewise, they offer it with chicken as a no-cost substitute.They have a pretty good beer selection as well.

They have really solid pub grub and an interesting beer list. The menu is simple and made up of appetizers, burgers, hot dogs and cheesesteak sandwiches, but each of these has a few nice twists (smoked hot dogs, burger with humus, etc.) and they're all made very nicely. The owner is often around and will check in on you to see how your meal has been, which is nice, too.

Food was so disappointing - hummus tasted like it was a about to go bad and read good reviews about Mac and cheese and burgers but the Mac did not have any favor and burger is beyond greasy. I really wanted to like this place - maybe they had a new cook but will not go back
I love love love this place.  Great atmosphere, live music, and great beer selection.  Even with all of that my favorite thing will always be the Jack Mac.  The best mac' n cheese I could ask for!!

Definitely a "hidden gem" in Charlotte!  I've walked by this place many times on my way to other restaurants in NoDa, but never stopped in until today (from the outside, it just looks like a dive bar).  My husband and I had lunch here this afternoon, and WOW-everything was really AMAZING!  The Mac n' cheese is by far the best I've had in Charlotte.  I highly recommend the Jack Mac!!  The Hawaiian chicken wrap and boneless wings are also delicious.  Can't wait to come back!
Great food, relaxed atmosphere, quick service, excellent beer selection. What else do you want? The Bayou Burger is fantastic.

Just when I thought that NoDa was on the verge of losing its identity, I was introduced to Jack Beagles.  While I hesitate to call JB a "hole in the wall" because people might shy away from the place, I want to call it a "hole in the wall" with great affection and admiration.  This is your classic neighborhood bar, but with a fantastic beer selection and great food. 

I've only had two food menu items:  the hand-battered corn dog and the fries.  As many other reviewers have said, the fries are more like thick-cut chips and are the most delicious potato I've ever eaten.  I could eat a burlap sack full of them.  I there was a Groupon for "burlap sack full of Jack Beagles fries" I would buy it.  

A sample menu of the beers I've had a JB:  Heavy Seas Siren Noire, New Holland Dragon's Milk, Abita Vanilla Porter and Oskar Blues GNIGHT.  Not shabby at all.  Pretty damn good, if you ask me.  

The atmosphere here is nice and has an eclectic mix of people.  But, dammit!  I can't get away from Will Puckett's art in this neighborhood.  His paintings will always make you realize how much better he is than you.  Per the sign in the men's room:  if you see Will, buy him a beer.
I ate here yesterday and she staff and food was awesome I would recommend them. Very nice clean and staff was awesome. The burgers are to die for.
One of the best places to not only grab a bite but enjoy live music as well as excellent service from their staff, specially managers Alexz & Mike!
Great burger, decent mac. Only complaint is it felt like wind tunnel with fans on and a/c directed right at tables.  Would visit again.
this place consistently makes awesome food. great atmosphere, great prices and best of all, THE BEST Mac m cheese..Try the Jack mac!

I love this place! It's extremely clean and the people are so nice. There are the occasional drunk or two, but stay out of their way and they won't bother you. The food is fresh and cooked as soon as the order is placed. I love the burgers and the chicken fingers are amazing. Try the Mac-n-Cheese too! 

The location is kinda odd, the first time I went there I was meeting friends and I walked by the place a couple of times before realizing that it was right in front of me. It's really laid back and cozy.  The outdoor patio is heated in the winter and has live entertainment.

The prices are really reasonable for an up and coming neighborhood like NoDa. I plan on bring all of my friends here!
Shit on a shingle is great and brunch gets an A+ in my book. Chill, laid back atmosphere. I describe it to others as "the bar in NoDa with no sign outside".

Came to here to have a beer and ended up eating some food. I had the pork tacos and they were awesome. Very tasty with the mango salsa which gave a sweet taste to the tacos. Will definately be back for a brew and the tacos.

The new outdoor seating area is big and are looking forward to music playing out there this summer.
Stopped in for a late Saturday brunch. They weren't too busy but pretty inattentive and annoyed so we left.

Came here one night and was really surprised. They had a wing special (think it was Wednesday and half priced). The wings were perfect did a few shots and called it tonight. Couldn't complain at all! Fast friendly service, awesome price, good food, and nice drinks....I'll give two thumbs up!!!
Great food, inexpensive, and fun atmosphere.  On one occasion, I took a somewhat large group there last minute and they were very accommodating.
All of their burgers are on point! Love their garlic infused Mac and cheese and their coleslaw, delishhhhh.
This place has delicious food and a great atmosphere. I've sampled most of the menu and haven't been let down yet! My favorite thus far is The Stugot cheesesteak!!!

We had the fries how you like 'em for an appetizer -- we got chili, onions, and tomatoes -- and the fries were waffle, the chili delicious, and the effect was impressive. Then the burgers came, and they were large, and delicious (decent-sized buns, not those tiny things). And with the burger came the Mac & cheese, and it was surprisingly good (and I'm kind of a mac & cheese snob). So the food was better than I expected, and the prices were reasonable, so I'd say that's a win-win. Now, if only they'd put up ANY sort of a sign outside identifying the place, more people could find it. So if you're in NoDa, check it out, but be sure you have the address.

Pros:
Food was good
Parking was easy to find
Service was good

Cons: 
Mixed drinks were not good. Other reviews mention beer, but we don't like beer. 
It was crowded (because it isn't very big) 
It was hard to find at night, no sign - or if there was one, it wasn't lit up.

The other day i stopped by after hearing good things about their special mac and cheese and beer selection. I highly suggest getting the "JackMac", very good. Creamy with a little bit of kick to it, just awesome and very filling. Will be back next time to try something different!

This place is amazing. As a NoDa resident, Jack's Beagles is the only food that I can consistently eat from the restaurants around here. The prices are very reasonable considering the great quality of the food! The pork tacos are ridiculous, all the macaronis are incredible, classic Mac being my favorite, the burgers are delicious, and my god is the widow maker amazing!!

Terrible first visit. Let it be said this place is incredibly cheap. Great prices and a nice breakfast/brunch menu on sat and Sunday. That is where it stops. Arrived at 12:45 on a Sunday. Sat and waited... and waited... and waited. Finally. After getting a menu craving some brunch I ordered a beer and... waited. Food order finally taken at 1:15 only for the server to come back and tell us that they stop brunch at 1pm... Well then... Understandable that we were cutting it close but the service was ridiculous. Few tables on the patio and a few inside. Not busy by any means. However. The beer was delicious. Asked for a HOPPY ipa and was not disappointed (not sure what it was). After the long wait and no brunch settled up for the beer and headed to Cabo. Sad I really want to like this. Maybe down the road.

At a glance, this looks like just another bar where you might expect to find some greasy pub food. I stopped in because my roommate recommended the place, and I sure as hell don't regret it. Lee, the bartender, is clearly a fan of the food and gave me his first and second choices for each category when I asked for a recommendation. I took my cues from him and had possibly the best pulled pork I have ever tasted (along with some great mac n cheese). Lee also kept my water glass full, which is no small feat. All in all, I was very impressed and I will be back.
Great food and music. Best buffalo chicken sandwich I've had in forever! Get the Mac n cheese, no seriously you should get it. You won't regret it.
I absolutely love this place. If it were closer I would go once a week. My favorites are the chili cheese fries and the Mac and cheese, they've always been perfect!

Went here after the Parquet Courts show. Jacks Mac and cheese is awesome. Prices for everything seemed perfectly reasonable and both hot dogs and burger were tasty. The band  even came in after the show to eat, very cool. Most of them are vegetarian, so they must have been happy with the veg options since they stayed and ate. Went back another day and had the Philly. Also good. Nice dive bar option in Noda that never seems over-crowded.

Hard to find good live music in Charlotte but this place is built for it.  In the winter they have an amazing outdoor heater system so it's like you are outdoors.  They have good specials and embodies the NODA atmosphere.

Get the mac and cheese. I do not see how anyone could not like coming to this place. It is amazing. Prob the best food you will find after 2 am when the bars close. Very chill and very good. That's really all you need.
I had one of the best burgers I have ever had in my life,  the Blue Bayou!  Great food,  great service,  and good beer selection
$1 beers! Love to dollarbate whenever I can.  Had the Stugots sandwich and it is delicious.  Basicly it's a cheese steak sandwich with peperoni instead of green peppers... yup, delicious.

Ate here 2 different times now. I'd give this restaurant a higher rating if they'd iron out a few details. A big one for me is that they serve instant sweet tea, not brewed. Huge difference in flavor guys!! I love me a good glass of sweet tea with my meal. Also, when asked for my biscuit to eat my gravy with, it was literally hard as stone. No kidding. I showed it to the waitress, and she did bring out 2 fresh ones. But, it was a joke at our table. Food was ok... Potatoes/home fries needed more seasoning. Bottom line, I'll be back. But, not for a while to see if they got real tea to serve to their customers.

We're out of towners in for a late bite. Food was delicious and the bar was as expected. I definitely recommend the Widowmaker (seriously yum) and the black and blue mac n cheese might almost be TOO blue. definitely for a Blu cheese lover. Staff was prompt and friendly!

Fun place with good food and beer! Burgers, sandwiches ,hot dogs, cheese steaks, etc. Must try the mac n cheese! They have a few different styles so don't pass that up! Friendly employees and quick service.

I would eat here every day if I could. The only thing they are missing is a macaroni and cheese sampler so I can have them all in one sitting. Absolutely amazing food, great staff, and if you have a choice, always, always, always try some mac and cheese.

The food was really good and fresh.  We had the hot garlic wings and the Hawaiian wings.  The hot garlic ones were great but the Hawaiian wings were just ok, they could have used some more seasoning.  The waffle fries we're also great, they stayed crispy the entire time until we got to our destination.  Even after being closed up they were not soggy.
New favorite pub in Noda! $1 Lionhead cans...2 for $5 top-your-own hotdogs....friendly bartender. I like it...I like it a lot!

They have tasty burgers and tenders. We went last night, and they had a great high gravity beer on special for $3. Can't beat that!

I had the patty melt which was very flavorful, if a bit greasy, on Texas toast. It was served with a side of waffle fries. The fries have recently started some type of seasoning, which I can't place. It's neither good nor bad, it just is. 

The chicken tenders are always a great choice. They have a light breading, and there are a variety of sauces. We tried leg jumper based in the reviews of other helpers. It was a spicy mango habanero. When it was too spicy, we asked for honey mustard. That was an additional 50 cents on the bill for a second sauce. Lame. 

The patio is nice, and I recommend sitting out there.

Came here one Saturday for lunch because the place we were trying to go had a long wait and we were too hungry to wait. 
We sat down right away and ordered right away. The first waitress was really nice but another waiter was in training and he took our order. 
I ordered two hot dogs with a side of fries and my husband ordered a widow maker philly with a side of mac and cheese. 

The food took over 30 minutes to come out. Im not sure if they were having an off day but 30 min for a hot dog and cheese steak is pretty ridiculous. All the tables around us looked pretty pissed waiting for their food. 
The food itself tasted like food from a carnival. soggy bun with store bought sausage. My husbands sandwich was served with the fries I had ordered with my hot dogs and his mac and cheese never came out. The fries were sooo crispy it tasted like potato chips. Overall, very bad experience. Will not be coming back.

We went in today for a bite w/ our child, since we saw another family there.  Let me say that we loved the atmosphere for adults...for drinks.  It took well OVER 30 minutes to make 2 hot dogs and fries (which were burnt) w/gravy and cheese. Oh, and the my coke was practically flat.  Good luck to them but if your going to do food, they really need to step it up a few notches.

For only being to 3 bars and 1 brewery in NODA, I'm probably not qualified to critique but I really liked this place.  Love the dive-y but not scary atmosphere.  Exposed brick walls and all types of art hanging around. I didn't eat but did get a look at the SOS and I'm definitely interested. Nice area out back for us smokers, (boo hiss) but also great for dogs. Plus they have a giant heat lamp that hangs from above, so warm that I felt a little like a french fry but hey, better than the alternative.  Tip: that cool art is also for sale and not too bad. I bought the giant dog art right off the wall!

My husband and I ate here today, and as always the food is excellent. My only complaint is management. The manager was talking extremely rude to her staff in front of my husband and me. The issue that I had was she was visibly disrespecting her staff for clearing tables and bathroom checks continuously; however, she stayed seated at a table texting on her personal cell phone while calling out orders. It even got to the point the cook brought her a bowl of food out., as he was waiting on her hand and foot. You could tell her staff was visibly upset by the way she was treating them, but didn't have the voice to be able to speak. As a customer,  I can use this platform and hopefully the owner/upper management  of Jack Beagles can get to the bottom of this serous management issue.

Walking past JackBeagles, I never suspected it to be so great!  The signage is minimal and doesn't do this place justice, but I can't reduce my rating because of a lack of signage!  

Went there with a group of 6, and had a great time.  The lighting is good, the exposed brick is perfect, beer selection is unique, refreshing, and affordable, and the menu is interesting.  NoDa lacks great food, until now.

I love this place.  I'd love it even more if it was in Plaza Midwood, but what can ya do!  

Their fries are this insane potato chip-had-sex-with-a-french-fry concoction and they are AMAAAAAAAAAAZING.  they apparently bake them & then fry them.   I have yet to have anything on the menu that I haven't liked & the same has gone for everyone i've taken there.  they've all raved about the food & one friend after finishing off her burger & fries ordered a 2nd basket of fries she thought they were so good!

they have a killer beer selection, which rotates near constantly (so their beer menu is never up to date, my only gripe) but who cares when on a tuesday you can get a Big Boss Big Operator for half price??

I really need to check this place out for breakfast though, it sounds yummy & cheap.

I haven't had a whole lot of the food here. The drink specials are usually great, but the food is lacking when it comes to meat-free options. I have had the build your own fries which is a nice treat after practice now and again. A few weeks ago I finally got to go for brunch. The prices were on par with typical breakfast places like Ihop. I had the tradition breakfast of eggs and hash browns hold the bacon. I asked for toast but they brought me biscuits so I tried them and wasn't impressed in the least. They were very heavy and dense. They didn't have the flaky texture I was looking for. The biggest plus here is a great beer selection and a cool patio.
Order from here every now and again and today I found a wrapper clearly cooked into the sandwich meat.

Everything you'd ever want in a dive bar. Not to mention killer breakfast on the weekend.  The same place you might stumble in at 2am on a Saturday,  packed to the brim, is quaint and charming enough to take your mom for a nice lunch. Great service,  nice beer selection,  excellent burgers,  and famous Mac n cheese. Yes, please!
Great drinks, and food! Actual bbq style hot dogs!!! Love outdoor grill dogs!!! Good music and outdoor are was a nice vibe as well!
10 stars.  The best food in Charlotte.  Every one of their macs is mind blowing.  Fire grilled burgers.  Nice music scene.  Love jack beagless!!

I was introduced to Jack beagles a while ago from a co-worker of mine. He raved about the wings and the mac and cheese and I have to admit he was correct although I have fell in love with the cheese steaks, usually the Widowmaker but more recently the Stugots. Words cannot describe how delicious this sandwich is. Bread is nice and soft and the pepperoni gives it a different flavor. Would definitely recommend. The atmosphere in Jack beagles is pretty cool and laid-back. We like to head out back to the patio and listen to live music. I knew they were dog friendly but for some reason I never paid attention to it. If I had to have a complaint about anything it would be how employees come and pet dogs and then they are around food. Now I didn't see my server do this but I did see several employees pet the dogs there on the patio and then go serve food. Now I know that pets are like some people's children but I would prefer if the person that is handling my food not just get licked by a dog. Other than that I love Jack beagles and will continue to frequent this establishment. I'll just make sure I keep a hawk eye on my server.
Mac n cheese.... Yummmm! You get 5 selections to choose from. A must try!

We went around 5 on a Friday, and had no trouble finding inside seating. The back patio was filling up and preparing for live music. 
Our waiter gave us some good suggestions for beer. We started with wings and added waffle fries for $1. The wings were ok, sauce was great but wings were plain. Just warm chicken and skin with sauce on bottom of plate- next time I would ask that they be grilled, fried or charred. This is why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.

But we did not go there for chicken wings we went for burgers! We were not disappointed. I had the classic with American cheese, Little mayo, lettuce , onion and tomato on a great roll. My son ordered the bleu cheese burger which was covered with yummy toppings and perfectly cooked. I cannot say enough about how good though rolls are, like a kaiser roll but not as doughy.
Great beer, great service, great burgers and fun venue.

Great service and tasty bar food!  Wings were wonderfully cooked and had great flavor.  The Jack Mac (macaroni and cheese) was a great twist on a classic.  Loved the slight spice and fresh garlic.  The classic philly and cheese was awesome.  The bread was spot on and the steak had so much flavor (get the wiz).  We'll be back!

I love this place. Can't get over the Mac N Cheese they have. They literally have any Mac N cheese combo you could think of. Just had the mexi-mac. F*#K !!!!  Also, the boneless barbosa wings, my lord!!!!!

One of my favorite places to get a bite -  the philly cheese steak rocks, pork belly tacos and of course the Mac and cheese options.  Laid back bar type atmosphere w live music on most evenings.  They have a large patio to take advantage of sunny days.

I just had my first breakfast here on a Sunday which starts at 9.  Super super good w lots of options.

Always top notch service.

Giving 4 stars even though the food sucks because it's an awesome place to hang out especially when there's live music out back (shout out to Falcon Heart- best cover band EVER)- go to drink and have a good time, just don't eat the food.

This is a good place to eat for a good price. Wednesday is half off wings and they are delicious! Try the barbalo sauce if you can't choose between buffalo and BBQ like me. The appetizer chicken tenders are juicy and the breeding is very tasty! Plus they come with French fries. You can't beat that. 

The best thing on the menu is the Mac n cheese. You can't go wrong with any of them. I have noticed if you go during non rush hours (probably before 5pm) it's super cheesy. But honestly any time is good and they make it to order so you know you aren't getting 1-2hr old pre-made Mac n cheese. You might be thinking a bowl won't fill you up, but trust me. It will!! 

They have pretty good beer specials and prices. The bar staff has always been good and most people at the bar are friendly. 

Around 5 or 6pm they dim the light and the music gets a little louder so if you are looking for a more quiet environment come a little earlier. It's a good bet that they will have live music on the stage in the back and every time I've been there or walked by it been great! Good place, fun times. If your in Noda and need a place to eat for on the cheap stop here. Or if you have a craving for Mac n cheese don't even consider anywhere else!!
Best drunk food ever.  The boneless wings are amazing, burgers and Mac and cheese!.  Good music, the best place in noda to get some late night eats.

Went tonight on the recommendation of other Yelp users, hoping for the best.  There was a table available with no wait, and the service was superb.  Food was outstanding!  Had the Blue Bayou burger, the pulled pork sandwich, and sides of mac and cheese and chili.  EVERYTHING was terrific.  Extremely fast service, great prices, and overall a wonderful surprise.  Had no idea this place was even there, and the other reviewers who mentioned the lack of signage weren't exaggerating.... There is no sign in the front other than a small white board inside the front window with a handwritten "Jack Beagles" and the daily special written on it.  Am almost glad it's hard to spot -- Would hate to have to wait for such great food and service if word really got out!  Fabulous!  (We actually recommended the place to a couple that were debating whether or not to go in after they found out about the wait at the place a couple of doors down...... Hope they liked it as much as we did!)  Will definitely go back.  The wings looked really, really good!

Oooooooh Beagles, how do I love thee, but the last 2 nights in a row you hustled me on my tab.

I really hope this rant doesn't affect my future service at this place, even with the bad rating I will return and hopefully update this with a higher rating in the future.  I can't not come here, its probably the best place in NoDa for a reasonably priced food and beer.  That patio will be rockin in the spring.

I'll tell the 2 stories though.

The first night I ordered a ripper, awesome dog for the money.  I got the special tropical version with mango.  Soooo tasty and I'm not a hotdog lover.  It says on the menu $2.99, $1 more for a jumbo.  I would assume that that means it would come to 3.99, but it rings up 4.50.  I asked my waitress about this and she said nobody had ever complained before.  I told her that it didn't really matter that nobody had noticed the overcharge I wasn't going to pay it.  She said she couldn't do anything about and got the manager.  He was seemed friendly at first but then actually had the nerve to tell me "its only .50", I agreed with him.  Yes, its only .50, but it took some bickering back and forth before I could it taken off.  If the customer catches you overcharging, don't argue with me about it.  Ironically, I was hilariously talking NASCAR with the owner at the table next to us but I don't think he noticed what was going on.  I still tipped the waitress $5 on this small tab, just to let her know it was the principle of the matter, not me being a cheap ass.

But, I still love this place, so I came back the next night.  It seemed like the perfect segway between the Triple C elite event and the absolutely amazing Emancipator show at the neighborhood theater.  Plus, they had hop slam and 1/2 priced wings, or at least advertised half priced wings.  I ordered 12 wings, the menu says they are $9.99 and the specials board said half priced wings, so that comes to $6.50 right?  No, half of $10 is $5, easy math I thought.  When I asked about it, I was told that the half priced deal is only on the 6 wings and I didn't order 12 wings, I ordered to orders of 6.  I thought that 6 wings were only $6, not $6.50 as well, but maybe I was mistaken.  This time I didn't make quite as big of a deal about it as it was still a good deal.  But then, as we started to leave my friend noticed her purse had been sitting in a pool of water that they neglected to clean up.  Her key FOB for her car was ruined and all of here business cards were as well.  Not completely their fault as the customer who did it should have fessed up, but PLEASE get your $@!^ together people.

Moral of the story is, this place is awesome and the prices are fair, but please just let me know if you are going to charge me more than what the menu states, maybe if I was drunk I wouldn't notice, but that practice just ain't right.

Fun bar, great bar food.

If you're drinking in NoDa, you need to go here.

Get something fried, go out back and listen to a mediocre live band, and drink excessively.
Food was amazing!!  The place is cute and Alyssa was great and very attentive.  I'll be back for sure

This place didn't stand out. It wasn't bad either though. I rolled in here needing some food late after a concert. It took a lengthy amount of time to be taken care of. Aside from sitting down and waiting for nearly 15 minutes for the waiter to acknowledge us her service was ok. They were missing the most famous local craft brew which was disappointing. The food was average pub food. I wouldn't go in here expecting wow but it should meet most standards.
Loved the dumpster fries! We also had double mimosas and burgers. Was a great early lunch. Would definitely come again!
I stumbled upon this place last night. There was a fantastic blues band playing with ample outdoor seating. The bar staff was friendly and the drinks were affordable, what more can you ask for?

In reply to the owner, on my previous review:
I think you misunderstood me a bit. I was asked to stand outside and finish my hot dog, and then I could come in. I was not asked to leave for being intoxicated. When I came in, as I was told I would be allowed to, he asked for ID which I provided. I then made a joke, and was pushed out the door despite the fact that I was not resisting or denying leaving whatsoever. He just said "Then you can get out again" and pushed me. "Escorting" and pushing are two wildly different actions. I don't think that's fair or professional. After the owner of another business who witnessed the whole thing reasoned with him, he then told me I could come inside. If I'd been in the wrong, I don't think this would have been his ultimate decision.

We've been to JackBeagles 3 times so far. The bartenders are always friendly, the food is delicious (the pimento Mac and cheese is out of this world kinda good)! They have a nice inside with tables and bar seating, and seating outside that is covered. We will definitely be back!

Stopped by here on a whim one day and I never looked back. 
Apparently, it was brand new the first time I went which explained why I wasn't sure how I ended up in this place or why I had never heard of it. It began as any awesome place should. Small menu on a piece of paper, drink specials on the board, fun wait/bar staff and a casual, artsy atmosphere. First impression was that it is s.m.a.l.l. I wondered how we would fit a large group in here on a Friday night while we're bar hopping, but do not fear. We've done it successfully many times since then. After gathering my visual impressions, I ordered a beer the waitress suggested and some food and all I can say is HOLY. The beer was a cider-type something or another and it was sweet, light and delicious. The food was a California Philly. I didn't think I'd like the food but I gave it a shot and I am SO GLAD. The fries are more like thin potato wedges with spices and they're fantastic. I love a bar with unique fries - makes a lasting impression. I've since tried almost all of the menu items (which they continue adding to) and I love it all from appetizers to entrees to the new breakfast menu to the excellent beer selection. Double date night coming up? Hungry after bar hopping? Not sure what to get for dinner on random Tuesday night? Jack Beagles has NEVER let me down.

Stopped by because I heard they have good cheesesteaks. When we arrived, no one greeted us so we kind of just stood there. We actually walked out to go somewhere else but went back bc I thought, well I'm here let me just stay and try the food. The second time we came in, we stood there again but someone eventually greeted us. Our waiter was pleasant but the whole time I kept thinking about how rude it was that we were ignored and not greeted or told we could seat ourselves. I ordered the cheesesteak, hotdog, and macaroni. The cheesesteak was ok. Not the best. The hot dog was pretty good. The mac and cheese was very good. Overall the experience wasn't the best and the food was decent. I would go back for the Mac and cheese if I happen to be in the area.
A great bar in NoDa, there weekend breakfast is very good. Ask for the S@$&? On a Plate.

Holy crap!  We've eaten burgers all over the country.  I've never had one as good as this.  I got the one with pepper jack cheese and jalapeños (can't remember name) and it was juicy, extremely tasty, and irresistible. The female in our picture got the blue cheese burger and, believe it or not, it was better than mine.  We also got some blue cheese and bacon mac and cheese that was very, very good.  When I get a hamburger craving, I'm coming here.

There was a mix of people... bikers, college kids, old people, and good-looking ones like us.

In the last year, my fiance' and I have had the chance to try a lot of different restaurants in Charlotte.  

For a comfortable, low key, well priced meal, I can't go wrong here. It's a fun spot in NoDa with a little stage for live music.  I simply adore the food here. From their burgers and cheese-steak sandwiches to their specialty mac n cheese it's all a win. 
And they have daily food and drink specials.

The only thing I'd change is I'd prefer my Guinness on tap than the bottles.

My husband and I come here almost every Thursday night for beer and hot dogs - which are delicious and cheap! You can get a hot dog, with variety of toppings (I usually get mine grilled with sauerkraut and spicy mustard), for just $2.50, add a side, like fries or coleslaw, for $1. Best deal EVER! Beers on tap are local and are changed frequently. Addition: The macaroni and cheese is to die for.

The music is like a box of chocolates, you never know what you're going to get. I've heard Prince, Smashing Pumpkins, TLC, it's all over, but usually themed for the night, i.e. the night I heard TLC was mid-late 90s hits. Sometimes it's 70s funk, or 80s rock.... Aaaand it's awesome. You get the picture. 

Our favorite bartender is Kristin or "Bunny." She's attentive, efficient, and super sweet and pleasant. 

There isn't much seating, so if you're a group of 5 or more, good luck with grabbing a table inside. I think they have live music out back and more seating, but smoking's  allowed (it's outdoors).

To sum it up: Jack Beagle's is a hipster dive bar, with good music, decent beer selection, and low prices. It's completely unpretentious and is, what I think, the jewel of NoDa.

We started our evening out with some friends at Jack Beagles to get some food before our eventual pub crawl through NoDa.  This was my first time here, but the burgers were recommended by our friends and I ordered the classic cheeseburger, while the wife had the vegetable pita wrap. I also ordered a Hopulent IPA, which they had on draft, among the 8 or so draft beers that they had to offer.  Burger meat was cooked medium since the waitress asked about my preference and my burger was juicy, but not really greasy.  The standard toppings included lettuce, tomato and onions.  I did not get a side, since we were just getting a snack and I was not too hungry, but I guess those are extra.  I really enjoyed their basic burger and would certainly try another one of their signature burgers next time.
The wife enjoyed her vegetable wrap, but found it a bit greasy due to the amount of cheese on the inside.  She actually removed a good bit of the cheese, and would probably try something else in the future or maybe holding the cheese on the veggie wrap.

The atmosphere was cool inside, as it was an old brick building that was a manufacturing plant in the past before it was converted to a restaurant/bar.  It was a little hot inside the place, probably due to the central open kitchen and the fact that it was 100 degrees that day.

I would return on a cooler day with no hesitation.

$3.50 Bloody Marys on Sunday, a Mac & Cheese section on the menu, bleu & bacon, jalapenos, chili, sweet jesus, bring them all.  Those wonderful little moon bites, freshly cut french fries.  Super nice staff.  Inexpensive booze prices anyway. I can't believe I don't live there.  Total boner for Jack Beagles.  They have recently added a great patio out back!

Jack Beagles is a nice, cozy bar (right, Brittany!) in NoDa & it's my go to spot for yummy cheesesteaks! Do yourself a favor & get one of these. So yummy!

Sundays are fun too, as they play sporting events & there are lots of people to see & talk to.

They do have specials, which they normally have posted on the chalkboard sign outside.

I absolutely LOVE Jack Beagles! I go there a few times a week for dinner and drinks and it has never disappointed! The food is amazing. The wings, the burgers, the mac and cheese, the breakfast, and especially the Boss Man hotdog. The staff is always so friendly and welcoming. Amazing food and service. Half the time I sit at the bar and have a beer while I wait on my takeout food and it has become my favorite spot.

I heart you beagles your staff is always so friendly, your food never disappoints me, breakfast, lunch or dinner you make me happy.
They have a great beer selection and I heard a rumor that they are going to be introducing a full menu soon.  By far one of my favorite places to grab a drink in Charlotte.  Eat a burger one of the best I've had in town.

JackBeagles does quite a few things right. Easy watering hole for the NoDa walker in us all, and plenty of bar food to fill the bellies of those pounding copious amounts of brewskies or other unmentionable swill. 

Gotta say I love the Rippers. I'm a fan of a hot dog just about any day of the week and JB's was right on the money. I like a little bit of char on my dog, a little white onion, relish and yellow mustard. However, "ripped," means split and deep fried. What the eff?! Who knew hotdogs could be more awesome. 

Plenty of beer to choose from here. Love that they have a good variety of bottles, too. 

Where I can't say this is my go-to spot for dinner or food in general when in NoDa, I really want to check out the brunch. With "Shit on a Shingle," which I haven't had in years, these guys have piqued my interest for a future Sunday brunch spot.

Alyssa was terrible.  I am rating the restaurant a 5 purely because of the bartenders and the great food but she was awful. I heard her talking crap about the staff members and she was super slow. So unprofessional. I will be back purely because Adam and Stephanie were such great bartenders.

The breakfast here is real.  

I have been to JackBeagles twice, both for breakfast on Saturday mornings.  I love that you can get right in this place, no wait, no fuss.  

I run the breakfast burrito, which is always made fresh to order, filled with soft, scrambled eggs, cheese, bacon and green peppers.  It's is very big and very filling (that's what she said, haha).  I have a buddy that always orders the eggs benedict, which he swears bye.  

The service is superb, especially at the bar where I always sit.

JackBeagles becomes a much more appealing option when you consider how packed places like Zada Jane's gets on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  The early morning simplicity is what draws me to Jack Bs for breakfast and is why I will definitely be back one morning soon.
Best mac n cheese in town! Great beer selection! Love the outdoor area in the back (that is dog friendly) with live music on certain nights!
My absolute favorite place in Noda and Charlotte. If you happen to wander in, ask for David. Top notch service from him everytime. Also, the buried treasure fries are dope.

I went here on the advice of Yelpers and was a bit disappointed. We arrived around 2 pm on a Saturday to the Queen City.

The prices are definitely on point. I ordered a classic burger with a side of mac and cheese. My boyfriend ordered the pulled pork salad. The burger was pretty good, but I was expecting to be REALLY blown away based on these reviews. As for the mac and cheese... eh. I like mine to be creamy and unbaked. I was hoping for more with that whole little menu of mac and cheeses and was very underwhelmed. (My boyfriend did like his salad.)

The service was not great. We waited over half an hour for a burger and a salad in a mostly empty restaurant. I didn't feel like the service was particularly professional. I don't mind a little wait, but this didn't seem proportional to what we ordered.

I really wanted to like it here, but based on my experience, I will not be back next time I'm around Charlotte.

My favorite bar in NoDa.  Good breakfast (and food in general but I pretty much only eat there for breakfast on the weekend), good beers, good music, and the bartenders are just snooty enough to keep you coming back for more.

Pretty good but not the best Philly cheesesteak I have ever had. Then again I am from up north so I have kind of high standards. All things told this place seems like a cool place to come and get a beer and chill out for the night.
Great dive bar.  Good prices and good variety of beer.  Laid back, NoDa attitude.  Good enough brunch. I have many good memories here.

Jack Beagles serves a great brunch and a mean Bloody Mary. My running group eats there every Saturday; they accommodate a bunch of sweaty, thirsty runners with no complaints. The only downside is that service can be a bit slow. I love their skinny puppy omelette and their breakfast taters are out of this world!

Mmmm. great food, cheap alcohol and a nice backyard/patio.  what else could you want.

tried the cheesesteak, french fries, and the pulled pork . all really delicious.

I was with a group of friends that wanted to get a bite to eat in NoDa, with a few requirements.  1) No bar food 2) No Revolution (they just ate there the night before) 3) No crazy wait.  Because this was a sunny, warm, winter day in NoDa, there were some crazy waits at Cabo.  

I had been to Jack Beagles once before for a quick bite and thought it'd be the perfect place.  We had a bit of a wait because all eight of the tables were taken and the patio wasn't quite open.  It was odd hanging out by the door waiting for a table with no recognition from the staff.

We finally got a table and were greeted by our waitress.  I ordered mac & cheese - the one with the pepper jack cheese.  A friend of mine, who loves everything super hot, ordered the hottest wings that they have.  The food didn't all come out at the same time, which was a bit weird, but it was all super good. 

I need to go back and try other mac & cheeses.  I love that a bowl is filling, but also easy on the wallet.

Pretty eclectic menu and good beer selection, though not many on draft.  Killer burgers and dogs don't come here if you are counting calories.  

Patio - Yes out back
Happy Hour - Yes

Amazingly rude bartenders. 

My co-workers and I, who all work in the service industry, went to Jack Beagles last night (2/25) after our shift. The bartenders at the outdoor bar called "last call" 5 minutes after we had already been standing in line. It took him 10 min to get to us, only to tell us he couldn't get us a final drink because it was too late. He showed me on his own phone that it was 1:58 am. 

Thank you for making us wait in line for 10 minutes to rudely not serve us, just because you were ready to leave. If you don't want to work late on the weekends, find a different job to be less than satisfactory at.

Was in the mood to try their SOS.  It's basically a southern version of a classic served on Texas toast and topped with sausage gravy,  plus they substitute the original chipped beef for chopped meat and onions.   Think of it as a Philly grinder smothered with sausage gravy.   For an extra $3 they'll put a couple fried eggs on it,  too.  Overall,  the meal was tasty and filling;  however, not really a monster do-over.   This sandwich wasn't unique enough for me to return to a bar that's just waking up and decided to cook breakfast.

Fun live music and really delicious food as well. Friendly staff. You can tell the staff cares about their work and the success of their operations. I enjoy getting drinks here at night and a quick bite during lunch hours.

I feel like my review for this place is unfair because i had to leave before being able to give it a really good try but the mimosas are good and I can't wait to come back and try the adult themed mac and cheeses.

Went for lunch, at about 12:30 on Saturday with the wife, so I thought. 

We were handed breakfast menus. Breakfast? At 1230? Yup! Asked for lunch menu. Was told can't get lunch til 1:30. That was weird. 

Had "breakfast". Wife had omelette with taters and I had SOS w/ taters. Food was okay. Wouldn't go back for breakfast. Probably won't go back for lunch due to the inconvenience. 

Really need to make lunch earlier.

I have to say that my pulled pork omelet was the best pulled pork omelet I have ever had - oh, by the way, it was the ONLY one I have ever had. 

Sometimes, you just need a quick, simple meal, and this was it for our last breakfast in Charlotte. The pulled pork was good enough, and the omelet well-put together, fused together with delicious cheese. I want to to say the biscuits weren't made in house, and the home fries were DEFINITELY from a bag, but frankly I didn't expect much more. 

This would probably warrant 3.5 stars, but I decided to round up since everyone was nice at the restaurant.

Really liked this spot.  Good food served up pretty quick, and a great price.  We had the hot garlic parm wings to start, very tasty.  As others have stated the fries were really good.  Chili was good too, I think I'll have it on a hot dog next time.  I enjoyed the cheesesteak but my wife wasn't a huge fan of it.  I liked that the steak was tender but she found it a little bland.  Regardless she is just as ready as I am to go back.  The music was an interesting mix but memorable...heard some throw back boy bands and Brittany Spears, and some Blind Melon I think.
Delicious, inexpensive, friendly staff and patrons.  New favorite laid back spot

Nicely crowded early evening dinner/bar scene. The dinner salad with chicken was large and delicious.  The kitchen here is always spot on. Nice selection of draft and bottled beer. Attentive and friendly staff. Great spot in NoDa.

Beagles might be one of my favorite watering holes.. EVER! As a local NoDa resident, I love how laid back and fun this bar is. No matter if you show up for Trivia on Tuesdays, to watch the game on Sunday or to just relax after a bike ride, Beagles is sure to make you happy.  Oh and their "Jack Mac" mac & cheese.. stupid good.

And you've gotta love a bar that has no sign out front :)

I ordered a French toast. Not only was it undercooked but it tasted mediocre. I could taste the runny eggs in the French toast. It was disgusting. I even told the waiter it was undercooked and he did nothing about it. No discount, nothing.

It was also served with packets of pancake syrup, which is not impressive. I am very disappointed and I will never come back here. What a waste of money.
Mac and Cheese is to die for! They serve food till 2am! They have a front (indoor) bar and back (outdoor) bar! Outside they have a huge stage that try book live music for!

Super friendly staff and excellent food. So much bang for your buck! 

Drinks are strong, fast and cold!

Music venue leaves little to be desired. Get some bands in there! (Modern music)

Mighty mighty yummy bar food. Love the outdoor area- plenty of space to spread out and listen but not have to yell over the live music. I'm a fan of the build your own mac and cheese. Love that that their burgers are hormone free and all-natural. I enjoyed the sloppy joe and have magical things about the hot dogs here. Great bloody marys if you are in to that kind of thing. Combine my two favs the chili and the mac and cheese into some epic chili mac. Not much parking so best to bike or park on a side street. And best price- things are priced very fairly for the food quality.
They have a great patio!! Weekend brunch is super affordable, too. $ 'mosas and $4.99 b banana pancakes!

Very poor service. We were seated at 1:15pm and received drinks and our order was taken in a timely manner; however, the food never came. Our server never returned. We had to call her over in order to inquire about our food. At 2:30 she told us there were still 2 tables in front of us. We left. She was nice enough but had no knowledge regarding the menu or what the word "substitute" meant. With the new train line running from University to Uptown one would think the pubs would be working overtime trying to pull in new customers. Jackbeagle needs to make some serious changes if they want to compete. We ran into 4 parties at another restaurant who left Jackbeagles today because of poor service.

8 bucks a can for that stuff brewed down the street.  I just don't get it. Even the waitress was like yeah I know that shits too expensive. The band was playing Neil diamond covers and making me feel like a loser. They kept making eye contact and doing that blowjob motion. I felt violated. They played an incubus cover that made me reconsider being such a huge incubus fann. Emailed their publicist so they know what fuck shit goes on at JackBeagles. 

Skip.

I love JackBeagles. We come here for breakfast every couple of weeks or so. We love the outdoor seating area and they are very dog friendly so we always bring our two dogs with us. The staff here is amazing and the food is delicious. Very generous portions and they serve Pure Intentions coffee, which is amazingly yummy and made locally. Make sure you bring your appetite. The portions are huge. The pancakes, French toast and skinny puppy are our favorites and the biscuits are great too. But everything here is yummy. I've been here for drinks and bar food as well and it's always been a great time. Love supporting local and walking here with the dogs. They have our continued business.

Mike was handing out breakfast only Beagle Bucks Friday night when I stopped in for a beer.  So this morning, I took advantage of their opening at 7am on Saturdays and Sundays for breakfast and enjoyed a nice hearty meal.
I had the Basic Beagle Breakfast.  Two eggs any style (scrambled), bacon or sausage (3 strips of tasty perfectly cooked bacon), breakfast potatoes or grits (potatoes since i am still unwilling to let go of my Yankee-ness to eat grits), and biscuits or toast (two great biscuits), all with a little fruit cup.
They have breakfast wraps and tweaks to your standard breakfast fare.  Next time, I will venture for the Shit on a Shingle.  Up north, that is creamed chipped beef on toast.  There, it is more like your sausage biscuits and gravy only on texas toast.
All of it is reasonably priced and a great breakfast option in the hood that is open early.  Just sucks waiting until noon to wash it down with a mimosa or bloody mary...

Looking for a bar with good food, good drinks, a friendly staff, and nice people? Well normally I would tell you to keep dreaming because no bar has all of things at once right? That's what I used to say before I went to JackBeagles!

I first discovered this place a couple of years ago while hanging out in NoDa shortly after moving to Charlotte.  Since then I've been back several times.  

The staff is always friendly, it's like they actually enjoy their jobs and want to be there.  I can't say that I've ever had a bad experience here with any of them over the years.  I was pleasantly surprised by how friendly the other patrons are and how inviting the atmosphere is at a whole.  One of the  few bars I've come to where you can really just sit down and feel free talk to anyone. Just about everyone seems to be having a good time enjoying their food/drinks and very social.  I've met all kinds of people here.  If you come during evening hours they usually have some good music playing in the background as well.

But enough about the people, let's talk about the food.  First I have to get into the Mac n Cheese because this is the dish that's going to keep most coming back.  JackBeagles has hands down some of the best Mac n Cheese I've ever eaten (and I've eaten a lot of mac n cheese).  They have several different styles but if it's your first time then I recommend starting with the signature Jack's Mac.  Prepare to be blown away.  On your subsequent visits (because you'll probably come back), feel free to try the other flavors as they're all amazing.  My other favorite is the Mexi-Mac.

If you need something more then you have to try one of their hot dogs.  Trust me all you need is 1.  These things pack a delicious wallop.  For the bravest souls I have to suggest the Buried Treasure Fries.  These aren't your traditional cheese fries.  Once you order them and see all the things topped onto them, you'll realize why they're called "buried treasure" fries.   You might want to share these with your date as it's quite a bit for one person to handle.

I can't recommend this place enough.  If you're only in Charlotte for a short amount of time and want to experience a good bar atmosphere and at the same time grab a delicious meal, head to JackBeagles.  Good thing I don't live in this part of town or else they'd have all my money haha.

Super fun place to go on a Friday night! They had a live band playing with a decent size dance floor. Drinks were decent. We ordered the fries smothered in chili, cheese, and pork and they were pretty amazing!
Had the Carne Asada Tacos and a cup of the Mac n Cheese and both were awesome. Lots of flavor and highly recommended! Perfect for a quick lunch. Clean and nice atmosphere. Would definitely come back!

I mean shut the front door!  No really, get out of your house, shut the door and drive straight to JackBeagles.  This place is out of this world good.  Good beers on draft, friendly servers, awesome food, and great prices. The burgers and hot dogs are amazing.  I tried the Blue Bayou...I don't even like blue cheese, and I was scraping the crumbs off and smashing the homecut fries into the stuff.  Can't wait to go back and try one of everything on the menu!!

Good cocktails, and pub food for is perfect for when you're feeling like indulging.  I've had the Buffalo sammich, boneless wings,  and Philly cheese steak.  Was not disappointed at all, and everything is affordable.

When you walk in to JackBeagles, just keep walking until you go out the back door and find the back patio - this is why I keep coming back here.  The back patio has a large number of tables, a bar and a sometimes stage with live music.  

It's a bit divey and more than casual - making it the perfect place to grab a burger or wings and a beer with absolutely zero pretense.  

We like to go on Sundays to watch the Panthers and enjoy $6.50 double bloody marys and $5 large mimosas.

Jack Beagle's reminds me of something like Cheers. It's a local spot where everyone knows your name.  It's located in one of the artistic side of town of NODA. Which is filled with many eclectic and fun bars. The abeyance is real cool and laid back. Tables are comfortable and clean. I went for a late lunch on a Monday and was seated as soon as we walked in. The waiter came with water in hand and was ready for our drink orders.( That was great). We came in after viewing the menu on yelp. So we were ready to order.  I got the treasure fries with chili W beans ( don't be like me and let your eyes be bigger then your belly.) i also ordered 12 hot wings 1/2 hot and the other 1/2 hot garlic parm.  The food came out hot and was very good. The fries could have used a lil salt but hey they were still good. The service was great and it's good bar food.  Think I'll try their signature Mac. Don't look at me crazy because I heard it was amazing. Go try it for yourself and let me know what you think!
Good local spot in NoDa. Simple bar and dining section. Patio outback. Good mac n cheese and "ripped" hotdogs. (Deep fried until they rip open)

In the past I ate here ever firday with friends for months. However our schedule didn't work anymore so I decided to go back on a Thursday afternoon with new friends. Thought they would love it like I do. Needless to stay they complained about every thing!. Dog this Dog that..  so if you don't like dogs around your Are while u eat. This is not the place for you.
I will continue to come here for great drink specials and great food. Please try the blue mac and cheese. .. yummy! !!

Had the classic beagle hamburger today - it was good, waffle-fries were the accompaniment.  It was a Tuesday at lunch, so not many people where there - was pretty quiet.  I'll try it one night to better get a feel for the ambiance.

I really liked this spot - first time here and I like the bar area and the outback area.  I only drank here this time, but the table next to us ordered food and it look really good.  I could only imagine eating after four or five beers and it tasting really good too.

The bar girl was great too!

I'll be back.
First time in my life I've ever walked out of a restaurant. Waited over an hour for breakfast. Waitress apologized and gave us the option to leave which I thought was poor customer service.

My first time eating at Jackbeagles, it was actually fairly well. It was on a Wednesday night (15 July). The food was actually done and the customer service was actually comparable favourably with other burger joints I've been to. However, the last time, I feel as if they were sequestered (on a Wednesday Night 22 July). My order came within a reasonable timeframe, yet the order was not the way I ordered it. I ordered a burger with no jalapenos or Chipotle aioli. Secondly, they must remember that the customers do not want to see the underwear of your cooks, so their britches needed to be pulled up at all times. Thirdly, when someone say "well done", it should be well done, not medium rare. I would love not to die of botulism. 

I'll give Jackbeagles another try within the next 3 weeks. If no noticeable changes occur, I'll not return.

Delicious food.  The Mac n Cheese with garlic was spectacular.  My group had wings, hot dogs and burgers.  Everyone enjoyed the meal despite being BLASTED be cold air.
THEN..... the check came.  It was half price wing night.  3 people at the table ordered 12 wings.  On the menu 6 wings are $5.99 and 12 wings are $9.99.  This should put our orders at $5 each.  We were all charged for 2 orders of 6 totaling $6.50.  None of that makes any sense to me except incorrect ordering on her part, possibly trying to up the check average, and incorrect pricing on the menu.
Everyone at the table is in the bar/restaurant business and noticed the problem too late.  This will definitely stay in our head the next time we want to go out to eat, which we do a LOT.

Definitely a NoDa staple. Mostly come here for drinks and some music, but the food is good also. They always have a great assortment of local and not so local craft brews on draught. Great specials throughout the week, great patio area, dog-friendly, can't ask for much more.

So, I'm updating my review based on my great experience Wednesday 6/29. This our favorite spot in NoDa. Consistently, they have some of the best bar food, burgers and mac & cheese I've ever tasted. However, we've been dining here since 12' and the service is always the worst part. I don't want to say what all I have witnessed from the FOH staff but it has been awful at times. I know it's NoDa and all but service is service..whether at a bar or white table cloth. Last night, our server Logan won us back over. As a server myself, I saw that this guy went over and beyond! He greeted us promptly, brought our dog a bucket of water, and was just a friendly guy who made us feel welcome and taken care of. Logan rocks!

I really liked this place. Nice variety on the burger menu and the Mac and cheese is really good.  The service was wonderful and I liked the atmosphere. Nice selection of bottle/can beer as well as plenty of great choices on tap.  Prices can't be beat.
Definitely check it out.

Definitely a place to drink. And sadly, I came on a day that I didn't want to drink. My brother and I came upon this place hearing good things about it. I, wasn't hungry (surprised?) but my brother was so he got a meal and told me to order some appetizers. 

We ordered the mac n cheese and the buried treasure which was covered in beef, cheese, on top of waffle fries. They were delicious. The mac n cheese wasn't bad but the only problem I had was it was a little on the salty side. Though, I didn't have a good beer to wash it down so that's probably why it's a little salty. If you have some alcohol with that I bet it would taste awesome.

The service. Not bad. When we went in there it was during late afternoon so it was sort of dead. But, that doesn't matter when the waiter was nice and offered her favorites on the menu that made our decision for what to get. 

All in all, I would come here to drink and eat. But I want to emphasize, next time I'm definitely going to get a beer with my food.
The Sunday brunch breakfast burrito was unreal. Best breakfast is have had in a long while. The coffee was great. Staff is very friendly. Will be returning often!

Believe it or not the Hotdogs are ggggrrrreeaaaat! I had that plus the hidden treasure fries with homemade chili  (great), pulled pork, peppers and onions, and slaw. Amazing! I truly enjoyed it n so did my friends. I looooovvveed the slaw, so good!

If you're looking for atmosphere, this place has it. If you're looking for delicious food, I'd warn you to steer clear of here.

Came here on a busy Friday night. Tables turned quick enough for there to not be a wait. We walked right in and sat right down. We looked at the beer menu and while a decent size, I wasn't impressed. I don't know much about beer but I do love fun beers and I think there were about 4 of 5 to choose from. Not my style so I didn't order-no biggie. I'm here for the food anyway.

My boyfriend was in the mood for a burger and I was intrigued by their Mac n cheese. There were only three burgers to choose from. Meh. I got a pretty basic spicy one. Buzz words for my burger: roasted jalapeño, wasabi mayo, pepper jack cheese. Yes. I love spicy. I also decided upon the Stadium Mac n Cheese because it had beer cheese and a hot dog and pretzel on top(yum! Sounded like it was going to bring me back to my baseball fan years). My boyfriend and I are low carb so we got no buns for our burgers. ( I wanted my carbs to be from the Mac n cheese since that was a different dish). My boyfriend got the bacon and blue cheese burger and fried mushrooms.

Everything came out at the same time. The fried mushrooms, which should take maybe 5 min to make, came out last. *Confused emoji* My mac n cheese  looked and tasted like it had been sitting in the window, but unfortunately I think that just how it was supposed to taste.

I was bummed by everything we ate. My burger was definitely a basic burger. Like, those burgers you eat just because you're drinking. The ones that just make you sad and depressed about your life. There was nothing fun about this...actually I take that back, that wasabi mayo was pretty good and different, but that was the only thing I liked about the burger. Easily could have made one 1,000x better at home. 
My Mac and Cheese. SAD SAD FACE! This dish had SO much potential! Beer cheese is amazing. This beer cheese was not. I tasted no beer at all. It's a STADIUM Mac n Cheese! I need beer flavor! The macaroni tasted like this cheap stuff my mom used to buy for us growing up. .99 cheap from a discount grocery store in a box by a brand so "off" you wonder if it's even made out of anything real. The same goes for the hotdog. Cheap skinny hotdogs. Man, when I go to a baseball game I'm going for the FOOD. Big fat steamed ballpark dogs! This, was not that. And lastly, the pretzel. Oh man. Here in my mind I was thinking it was a soft pretzel (because isn't that what you get at a baseball game?) but again, so much disappointment. It was a rock hard pretzel stick smashed in the back and sprinkled on my .99 cent macaroni. Wow. I was like, ultra disappointed. So much that the whole night I was talking about going out on the town because we NEVER go out. Yeah, after this dinner I just wanted to go to bed. Which we did. I had three bites of my Mac n cheese and left it. Literally that bad. 

I feel like I need not to go into explanation about how disappointing the fried mushrooms were.They weren't those big fat juicy kind. Very dry and shriveled. Soooo basically you're eating fried batter. 

Here's the thing. My boyfriend, who doesn't care a lick about food. Said everything was great. Haha. 
So long story short: if you care not about food and want a great social spot, come here. The atmosphere was pretty fun. But if you enjoy taste and innovative food then this is not the place for you!
Amazing fried mushrooms, they taste just like chicken tenders! And the drinks are nice and strong.

Happened in to this upbeat little spot last weekend. Modern, friendly vibe and modest but spot on decor. My son had the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich with Ranch instead of the standard issue Blue cheese. My wife has the Cheese Steak with wiz. Very good looking sandwich and cooked excellent. I had the daily special which was Chicken Bacon Tacos. We shared the Blue Mac n Cheese and it was delicious. The waffle fries are fabulous! Excellent, friendly service and a great experience. Will definitely go back.

I can only speak for the breakfast because it is all I have tried, but it was great. I had two eggs with bacon(lots of it), and grits. Toast was great, the only problem is that it was too much food. I love the atmosphere, the staff is friendly and attentive.

The brunch here was great. It's a small spot with not much seating but they do offer seating outside. The waitress was nice. The breakfast potatoes were a fave for my girls. We wanted to try something different and we give it two thumbs up. They have a small brunch menu which works well. Their signature breakfast was amazing and their toast was thick and delish. Sorry I did not take any pictures but yes, gonna go for it again.

I'm hoping we went on a off night. We travel for work from LA and exactly a year ago we both had their blue cheese burger and loved it! Went back last week and it was disappointing, couldn't taste the blue cheese and it just completely missed the mark... I wonder what has changed. Our waiter was very friendly.

I stopped in hear last Friday night with a friend on a whim. I was skeptical of this place since I have never heard of Jack Beagles, upon my party finding a table a waitress quickly came over to take our order. She was nice but her knowledge of the food menu and beers were very limited. I eat primarily vegan so I thought I wouldn't be able to find anything great to eat I was wrong!!! I had the Primavera vegetable Flat Wrap wish was absolutely delicious!! They also had a nice outdoor patio with a great band playing!!

If you're going to JackBeagles, you're getting one of the mac and cheeses. That's just a fact, right? There's a mini menu of mac and cheeses to cover any taste-buds which means order them all if you show up with a severe mac and cheese craving. 

During my visit, I went with the classic mac and cheese as a side to the outdoor-style hot dog (outdoor-style = grilled) to accompany an order of wings for the table. Personally, the mac and cheese was the winner, followed by the wings and then the hot dog. I think I should've ordered more toppings for the hot dog so that's on me to change the next time I visit.

I visited on a beautiful Saturday afternoon right after the brunch was finished being served and sat out on the back patio since one of my dining companions was a sweet little pup. There were plenty of dogs out back that provided some entertainment for the humans and fellow dogs.

I found Jackbeagles to be extremely laid back with surprisingly good food.

The burger of the week was good! But the waitress mumbled and I didn't realize it was the only $5.00 burger! We were not even offered a Burger Passport until she wanted to get an attitude about it at time to pay! The other cheese burger was horrible and the two different types of mac and cheese were plain and microwaved to reheat!! Not impressed at all!

What a great surprise!  JackBeagles has been around for a year and a half, and it's so low-key that we drove right past it and had to narrow down the location based on the address (it's in between Cabo Fish Taco and Salvador Deli, but we didn't see a sign).  

We got there around 9 a.m. on a Sunday morning, and the place was about half full.  It's definitely a bar that just happens to serve food, and we were immediately greeted when we walk in.  Great service, friendly staff and absolutely delicious food.  We both ordered the Beagle Breakfast, which is 2 eggs, bacon/sausage, potatoes/grits and toast/biscuit, and neither of us could stop raving about how good it was.  I'm not even a biscuit fan, but theirs was awesome - light and dense all at the same time.  The eggs were super fluffy, the sausage patties were sweet and smoky, and the potatoes had a little kick.  The menu is fairly limited, but this is definitely a case of do a handful of things and do them really well.  Next time, I might have to get the S%!# on a Shingle, just for the fun of it.

Friendly service, good food, reasonable prices... What more can a girl ask for in a casual bar in NoDa? What? Amazing Mac 'n' Cheese you say? Why, yes! They have that too!

I'll certainly be back. The bartenders and kitchen staff (who you can see because of the open-kitchen floor plan) are extremely jovial and friendly. Everyone on the wait staff was smiling and joking around. It seems like a place where everyone is accepted for who they are. I really enjoyed it.

Went back to the old Jack Beagle for brunch after church and it was a 180 on all the stuff I had an issue with.

Everyone was friendly, was greeted at the door, my coffee and water full, and my waitress was fantastic !!!

The food is always great and this time the food and the service matched. 

Tip: if you want something so bad for you but is soooooo delicious get the shhh on a shingle... My personal fave.

I will be back and I don't have to convince the Mrs to come back for her fave pancakes . Let's keep this standard going... Awesome !

Side note : I started this review a few months ago but I used the phone app...... boo on the phone app.... Ive been back a few times and all issues I had before with brunch have been solved.... great job guys !!!!

Our occasional after-hours, late night stop for some excellent chow.  We've ordered the chicken tenders, mac n cheese, fries, and tried the jack mac this last time.  WOW!  Order this next time you go.  One day I'd like to try the breakfast I've been hearing great things about.

This is one of the best spots in NoDa.  Despite the fact that they didnt hire me in college (still salty after 2 years), its a great casual spot to drink and eat. Food is very consistent, service is good, and the atmosphere reminds me of home. Not for the health conscious tho as a heads up.

This is a great find!

I actually went to Jack Beagles for the first time beacuse I was directed there by a sign on the door of Salvador Deli (they were remodeling). The food was great (I had takeout that time). I went back yesterday and was amazed that I had found a new HOT SPOT. They are currently building an awesome back patio with a stage and I can't wait for them to finish. As for the food, I had the Blue Cheese Burger with fries and an order of the boneless wings in the Spicy Jack sauce. My friend had the Philly Cheesesteak (he's from Philly). We were totally impressed by the quality and flavor of the food. The burger was cooked exactly how I had asked, and the fries are KILLER. If you're going to get something that introduces you to JB's get the wings with the spicy Jack sauce. I could probably eat 10 lbs. of those! 

In addition to the great food is the excellent prices on their craft beers. They do not carry as many as some places in NoDa, but the selection is varied and CHEAP. I will be coming here at least once a week because I want to support places that provide quality to their customers.

I came here because i wanted a local spot with some good food and this didn't disappoint. It's located in Noda and you may almost pass it if you're not looking. I walked and was told
I could sit anywhere. The waiter came fast. We order their fries that come with chili, cheese, and slaw. They were amazing! I wanted to eat the whole thing but had to force myself to stop. I ordered two hotdogs. One had slaw and brown mustard the other had pickles, mustard, slaw, and bacon. They were amazing. I could of had two more. I was craving hot dogs and this hit the spot!! I'll be back soon! Plus they have the best fries ever !
One of my favorite spots in town. Always satisfied with the food, atmosphere and drinks. The Long Islands are the best! And during the week the performances are good.

Bring back late night treasure fries!!! They shut it down before 12....so not worth going for the one most delicious thing on the menu now that they basically stop serving any french fries by 11pm. The air conditioning was dripping water on us the entire time. And anytime after 11pm they are completely unhelpful with any customization of menu items.

Great neighborhood bar and late night go to!  This place has a awesome back patio, cheap drinks and the perfect menu for after a few of those drinks.  Wings and Cheesesteaks are both great; but the go to for me is the mac and cheese bowls- so many options and always hits the spot (the Mexi-Mac is my favorite with a good amount of spice!).  For being a "dive bar" the menu is surprisingly large; perhaps not the most vegetarian options but if you are a vegetarian just order two mac bowls and you will leave happy!

This is a fun place to go no matter what time of the day/night. Bands on the weekend pull in a good crowd out back. Hotdogs and their famous mac & cheese after midnight are always a great idea. And breakfast on the weekends will fill you up (I suggest the steak omelet!)

Ultimate hot dog spot! I've had a couple deluxe rippers and the pork tacos here and they're all crazy good! I'm usually not a big hot dog fan but it was hard not to try an island dog when the opportunity presents itself. Plus Bird songs Mexi Cali on tap puts this spot over the top for me!

I love this place so much! I wish I lived closer I would be a regular! They have a cool outside bar area along with a funky indoor area. Staff is laid back. Sometimes it takes a minute to get noticed once you sit down but after that your in the clear. Best Mac and cheese ever! I honestly have never had a bad meal here! Perfect spot for a relaxing meal!

Jack beagles is definitely one of the best stops you could make in Noda for an all around great experience. My boyfriend and I were looking for some late night dinner but at the same time wanted to try something we hadn't had a million times. The food was great honestly better than I expected and the service was awesome! Alex took great care of us she was clearly knowledgeable and seemed to really like her job. They were super busy and she was the only bartender but we never wanted for a thing. The prices were good drinks were strong and I loved the fact they served humanely raised grass fed beef, honestly the only thing that kept me from 5 stars was I that I was hoping for a vegetarian option other than just side items but all in all a must stop!

Decided to drop in after catching a show nearby. Loved the atmosphere, food was so so but not terrible. I had the hot garlic wings and the blue blk mac and cheese I think it was. I would be inclined to come back. I was a bit put off at our table of 3 being asked for a credit card to hold onto before we even ordered. If this is the norm maybe it should be posted for all to see.

Went over here last weekend for brunch, but we missed it. Ended up staying for a burger. The burger was great! I had bacon, cheese and mushrooms on it! Delicious! I ordered a side salad instead of fries and I was pleasantly surprised. I have also been here several times for drinks and always had fun. The first time I ever came to Jack Beagles Zach Galafanakis was in there. He had been shooting a movie in town and came in for a beer. It was pretty great.

Ratings based on Sunday brunch.

Service...4 stars.  Very well attended to, kept coffee cups filled and checked on us frequently.  Corrected an error in the order quickly and without making a request to do so.

Food...4 stars.  Very large portions, and the food was very flavorful and excellent.  I had a more traditional breakfast, whereas my spouse had a gigantic omelette that I helped her finish.
