Value...4 stars.  For the amount of food given, this was an excellent value.

Ambience...3 stars.  This is a divey type of bar.  There was outside back seating, which we did not choose, so can't say how that was.  The most important thing was that it was clean enough.

Overall, a very good place to go for Sunday brunch.

JackBeagles has recently become my "go-to" for a weekend breakfast...it's like a Budweiser: always fills me up, and never lets me down. 

I think it's always a good idea for a restaurant to keep a simple menu, execute a couple of items that you do really well, and don't overcomplicate or spread yourself too thin by trying to appease everyone. I think JBs really embraces this concept; they stick to a few basics, throw in a special or two, and keep the prices very reasonable. 

As for the building, I've always just walked in the front door (push don't pull), and sat right at the bar. I'd probably just classify it more as "counter-service" than bar, as the kitchen is visible and somewhat open, and the service up front has always been efficient. Side note: I like that the coffee mugs are just a random assortment from local businesses that they probably got for free...It's kinda like a koozie, it's always better to collect them rather than buy them.  

The inside has a real laid-back vibe, and you'll usually catch a couple of people at the bar completing a crossword puzzle, or just there sipping on some coffee. Striking up conversations with others is typically easy & comfortable. 

As mentioned before, I've only been for breakfast---but I'll definitely check out their lunch/dinner options if I'm ever bar hopping around NoDa some night.

Literally obsessed with Jack Beagles! If you're in NoDa and wondering where to go for beer and tunes, it's Jack Beagles. They are very well known for their mac&cheese. They always have love bands, their food is so amazing and they have a great beer selection. I love the service here too, very NoDa, very cool, gotta come here!

Good wings, chill atmosphere, friendly bartenders, strong drinks... what more can you ask for. It's right off the CATS Blueline with $0.50w wing Wednesday (after 5p). Don't meet me there, beat me there.

Great food and service!Our server David was so kind! He checked on us regularly and gave excellent service.The other employees there were very kind also. They loved petting my dog and telling my stories about their own dogs.I give this place 2 thumbs up!

Jack's has awesome food and an awesome atmosphere. This place is always busy on the weekend but for a good reason. They often host an open mic night that is always fun. It is a bit small inside, but features more open space in the back which is outside. Having the bar on both the inside and outside provides rather quick service. Don't limit yourself to just alcohol, they have tasty bar food that is sure to please your taste buds.

Really, I come here for the beer and the food is generally an afterthought. I have friends who are excited by their brunch and mac n cheese, but I find their food to be generally bland or oversalted. It's not bad, but not great. 

It's generic American with a little classy and a little trashy thrown in. For instance, they have a blue cheese mac, but they also have a cheesesteak-based version of "shit on a shingle" as a  brunch option. Their inspiration seems diverse. 

I was most recently there to try their brunch. The servers are usually friendly and ours was no exception. She was very new though, in the "make many trips, forget drinks, don't bring a spoon to stir the coffee" kind of way. Everyone's gotta start somewhere though, so we forgave the inefficiencies. However, when she brought out our meals piecemeal from the kitchen, my patience waned as my eggs cooled, waiting for the rest of my food to arrive. 

When it did, my "shit on a shingle" was filling, a good portion size, yet slightly too salty.  There wasn't enough gravy on the steak to actually cover the Texas toast and keep it moist. I had ordered scrambled eggs on the side to also eat with the gravy and not only were they only warm by the time my food arrived, they were also not cooked very well -- more like a fried egg that happened to have been stirred a couple times. The home fries, however, were delicious and well seasoned. My dining companion liked the whole meal though, dubbing it "so white trash" and "right up my alley." 

She got the French toast and it tasted good, though they went a little nuts with the powdered sugar on top.  Hers was standard brunch fare, simple and tasty.

Ordered the big south burger with a side of waffle fries. The burger was delicious and had no issues with my meal. Our server was friendly and nice but she seemed to be the only server there. My only complaint was that all our food was brought out at different times.

I'm glad the other reviewers saw what I did and I'm not just like...their biggest fan or something.

Love the staff, love the beers, love the atmosphere...I knew the first time I  visited it's "my" bar in NoDa, and it's always where I head.

Just had lunch with two teenagers and everyone loved their food.  Double bacon burger was a huge hit especially the yummy bun.  Another had wings...buffalo style.  And I of course had my usual pulled pork tacos which were fresh and had great textures.  We all had the Mac and cheese.....fantastic way to warm up on a cold afternoon!

-Amazing food
-Unbeatable prices
-Reliable and fair service
-Fantastic patrons

Jack Beagles' has all of the above. I moved to Charlotte in April 2012, having never been a big fan of bars and pubs. Too much riff-raff. Jack Beagles doesn't have that problem. I enlisted about five months later but I still go to this bar every single time I return home! I always get the same great service with the same great prices. I've eaten almost everything on the menu and nothing disappoints me. 

I met one of the owners once and frankly, he looks like everyone else working there. Jack Beagles' is my favorite bar anywhere and I'll gladly continue supporting this place. Special shout out to Henry, Alex, the cooks, and the hilarious DJ who's name escapes me at the moment. He's always got something great playing.

As long as the doors are open we will keep coming back! Drinks can be pricy if not ordered from the drink specials. 
The BEST food! Bleu cheese and bacon mac and cheese? Yes please! The fried mushrooms are so good and served with horseradish sauce. Cheesesteak, hummus, beer! It's win/win!

I really like this bar. It's a bar with good bar music and good bar food. Their fried mushrooms are delicious portabello slices with a great breading and yummy horseradish sauce. Go for the bigger dog- ripper style, you won't regret it. Finally, the Mac and cheese is amazing. Totally amazing. The back bar is a great space, dog friendly- though the music may be too loud, depending on your dog's noise sensitivity.

Great new spot in noda!!  Perfect for art crawl night because the patio outback is right next door to where the bands set up outside the deli.  There are picnic tables and tiki torches all set up under huge trees so you feel like you are in someone's backyard instead of just a bar.  The service here last night was awesome and super attentive.  Attracts a great ecletic crowd, not too young but just fun people from the neighborhood.  They have a great beer selection for those of us who are always ISO IPAs!!!  Cant wait to be back!!!  :-D

The whole NoDa area is very hipsteresque.   Not really my cup of tea.

But after seeing JackBeagles here on yelp and getting equally good reviews from the locals we decided to check it out.

Draft beer selection is a little on the small side, but all 8 taps are craft brews.

Music playing has a 90s atmosphere to it.   When is the last time you heard New Kids On The Block?!

I had the bird pig hoagie special.   Chunks of chicken, bacon and BBQ sauce on a toasted hoagie bun.

The Mac n cheese was pretty good too!

Again, I wish Yelp had half stars, because this was a 3.5 experience for me. 

I ordered the CHEESESTEAK with onions, green peppers, and mushrooms. I chose melted provolone as my cheese. I asked them to hold the mayo, because mayonnaise on a Philly cheesesteak is sacrilegious. I drank a STONE IPA, which paired well with the sandwich. (Harpoon IPA was on tap, but I didn't notice that until later.) Total price for my meal was a few pennies over $12.

I sat at the bar and watched the short order cook prepare my meal, to see if I could learn any secrets - I didn't. The cheesesteak took about ten minutes to arrive, smoldering lava hot. I liked the components, which were plentiful, and well cooked. The line cook used grilled steak, and definitely not "Steak Ums." I especially enjoyed the nice crusty bread. The sandwich lacked something tastewise, which was hard to pin down. I'm not saying that it was bad, or that I was disappointed, it just lacked some "oomph." There was no salt or pepper added to the meat, so that would have helped somewhat. At home, I would also have added a few shakes of garlic powder. Cheez Whiz would have added significantly to the authenticity of the taste. I've had better cheesesteaks, but I've had far, FAR worse. Portofino's/East still remains my benchmark for CLT. I haven't tried the food trucks - YET, but I will. 

My barstool neighbor was downing mixed drinks, and munching on WINGS with ranch dip and celery hearts. Both the drink and his food looked good.

A mother came in, accompanied by her small daughter. The female bartender told them that Jack Beagles makes a great BURGER. I watched this being prepared, and it surely looked delicious. I would probably order that next time. It seems that almost every other reviewer says their mac 'n cheese is amazing, so that would be a "must try" eventually as well. 

SERVICE was very good. The female bartender was friendly and properly attentive. I didn't have to wait for anything. There were a couple of loud young guys bragging on their drinking prowess, but no one was being overly obnoxious. The female bartender deftly kept them in check. 

I love the RELAXED ATMOSPHERE of Jack Beagle's and the wonderful LOCATION. 

There were large size TV's over the bar. 

I found the place to be very CLEAN.  

This place makes me wish that I lived in NODA.

Really liked the atmosphere of this place, we went here for breakfast on a Saturday and everything was good.  If you want breakfast in a unique setting this is your place.  We arrived fairly early so seating wasn't an issue but it could be a problem later.

We just love this place. The decor is just simple old keeping the vibe of what NODA is and we love that. Putting out great quality food with no frills. The Mac and cheese options here are amazing along with the taste and the price is only $5 which is incredible. Go for the Mac and cheese u HAVE to.

I went to Jack Beagles after hearing and reading reviews. The atmosphere was great and I was ready for some great Hot dogs in the Charlotte area. 4 different hot dogs were ordered at my table and when being served all were so wrong that we looked confused. Might I add that it too almost 35 minutes to receive our food at 6:30pm on a Tuesday. Questioned by the waitress we explained that we couldn't figure out how to give the right hot dog to who ordered what. The food was returned for a recook and 5-7 minutes later we had our correct hot dogs. However, this time the hot dogs were still cold, the buns were cold, toppings were perfect, and the fries were from the original plate. I tasted the jalapeno relish and fell in LOVE!! Regardless of how bad the first visit was I will be back to retry and finally have a hot dog location in Charlotte. TRY THE JALAPENO RELISH!!

One of my favorite neighborhood dives in NoDa! They are dog friendly via the back patio (heated in the winter). Wednesday wing night is my personal favorite time of the week to go ...especially because open mic night is always interesting. On the weekends they have live music which is always fun. Friendly locals, great wings, great beer selection and stiff drinks...need I say more? Not sure why it took my so long to write a review?!

Finally made my way here since we were on the hip side of town and were pretty much famished...  Luckily I don't have a problem talking to strangers because I knew where this place was supposed to be, but I saw no indication that it was actually there... If I hadn't asked the nice ID checking guy standing at the door, we'd have walked right past it... Can we at least get him a shirt that says JackBeagles? lol

I'm going to go ahead and put my cards on the table... If you put anything spicy in front of me, the battle is already half won... I love a nice, bold, spicy dish and that Jack Mac is the definition of delicious in my book... It's the perfect combination of cheesy, creamy and spicy... I will absolutely be back for that... The boyfriend got the Chili Mac and while it wasn't bad, the chili pretty much overpowered the mac... It was good chili, though...

We got two of the philly sandwiches... I got the regular one which was absolutely amazing... The bread was soft on the inside with a nice crust around, the fillings were nicely sliced and were packed inside great... I hate having to wrangle a messy sandwich... lol The boyfriend got the philly with the pepperonis and it was a hit with him... I liked it, too, even though he drowned it in mayonnaise... (Ick.) 

You know, it was the kind of night where I ordered a beer and it was decent, but I honestly can't even remember the name of it... And I didn't write it down... Sorry about that, guys... lol  They do have a solid beer selection, though, so I'd give it a whirl...

There's a new patio out back, apparently, but this hungry girl didn't make it past the plate this time... Next time we head in, I'll update...

Breakfast is AMAZING! I've had the eggs Benedict, omelet, and waffles and they have each been delicious. Service is great and the mimosas are also a must-have. Nighttime bar is a fantastic tome - local bands will play and the scene is cozy.

I LOVE HOT WINGS! Wild Wing is the only place I have found that has hot enough wings that are too spicy for me. However, I have found another. Jack Beagles have this wicked sauce that tastes sweet at first and then all of a sudden it kicks your ass. It was so hot that I had to go through two golden monkeys within ten minutes to try and cool my mouth off. I could only eat a few of them and after my big tall glass of milk arrived, I went ahead and ordered the philly cheese with Jack mac which is mac and cheese with a little kick. They were both awesome but I might need to tone it down on the hot sauce after being put in my place.

Nice! I was in search of a place with mimosas for Sunday brunch and this one does $5 double mimosas, woohoo! It's in NoDa and the atmosphere is like a sports bar without TVs - very casual and fun. The food was delicious and inexpensive. I will definitely be back.

Last night one of my roommates were in the area for Noda Crawl. After walking around for a bit we decided to stop for some dinner in Jackbeagles. After looking through Yelp earlier in the day, I read a lot of good reviews on the various Mac and Cheeses so I was enthusiastic to try it for myself.

Let me tell you, my bowl of their signature Jack Mac did NOT disappoint. It was everything promised in the description: a perfect balance of spicy and cheesy flavors. You can tell that the chefs at Jackbeagles put the time into making each bowl of mac and cheese in house (none of that throwing frozen noodles into the microwave business). It was the kind of food that left me feeling sad when I scooped up the last bite.

As far as the venue goes, it was a small space with limited indoor seating. There were tables outside but we were able to snag a table inside in the seat-yourself restaurant. The decor wasn't anything fancy or unique, but who needs it with Mac and cheese so good? Some servers seemed more enthusiastic than others but overall I had a great experience.

Breakfast hoagi is huge, u could split it. Very flavorful.

The taters were unbelievable. Crispy with a kick. One on the best tater sides Ive ever had.

The Shit on a Shingle was the best breakfast there. Steak and texas toast smothered in country gravy. I love this shit.

The mimosas were a little pricey.

I'm sure there's a cleaver reason this place has a name like it does but I couldn't capture it during my first visit.  Noda is chock full of spots like this one.  Unassuming, undercover and generally hole in the wall type places.  That's not a bad thing but I think this place just blends in.  Blends in until you walk to the back and out to the patio.  

The best asset is the back patio and it looks like they are putting more money into to make it even nicer.  Nice little stage for a local band to play certainly creates a nice environment to come and kick back.
Had a GREAT night at Jack Beagles- there was a band playing Saturday and the place was rockin. This is our new favorite bar.
Come on a busy weekend and pray you can find a seat. Food is good and so are the drinks. Great atmosphere with live music. Best part is its dog friendly

In my opinion, JackBeagles is one of the best bars in Charlotte. They have some of the most excellent food and you can never go wrong with their Jack Mac or Buried Treasure Fries. This is also an excellent place to go watch the game with your friends. They seem to always have some kind of live music whether it is an open mic night or an awesome local band like Swim in the Wild. This place can get pretty crazy on the weekends like any of the bars in NoDa but it is always a good time and never disappoints. They also have a pretty awesome selection of beer with usually at least one really nice craft beer on special for $2-$3. I highly recommend this place.

I have one phrase for you...... Mac-n-cheese.  And when I say that Jack Beagles does it right, I am not kidding. Who would ever have thought that this NoDa bar would have gourmet style Macaroni and cheese???  Well thank goodness my friend who had indulged in a drunken binge of trying some random menu choices stumbled on this.  We tried the traditional and the bacon and blue cheese one....... Omg.  Really, the pasta is traditional elbow macaroni and comes served in these large ramekin bowls, which means they are made for individual servings! Which means you don't have to share!!!!  The cheese was so melty and gooey..... The flavors were spot on! A nice bar to hit, if you are looking for a patio spot, too (in the back).  I am shamed to say that the Mac and cheese is all I've had here.... When it's that good, do you need anything more? No.....
Great local spot for good food & drinks!! Excellent wings & Mac&cheese! Service is great, friendly staff and clean restaurant! We visit frequently and always pleased!! Drink specials are awesome!!!

My favorite spot in NoDa, non-brewery. I've celebrated New Years, Halloween, St Patties day, and Just Drink days here, and loved every minute. Top tier pub food, shockingly good in my opinion. Always interesting art on the wall, great specials, and a superb place to bring friends. Meet here for a drink too, wonderful selection of bottles and cans, and the drafts are well chosen, said the beer snob.

I had heard about this place before, but hadn't had the chance to go. It's the kind of place that it's easy to miss unless you're looking for it. I dropped in for some late night noms the other night though, and was very pleased. 

I wasn't very hungry so I just got fried mushrooms, expecting the little button mushrooms you usually get. Boy was I surprised when these giant slices of fried goodness appeared before me! They went awesome with the horseradish sauce that came with it, a nice change from the typical ranch. My friend got a burger and it looked incredible. I can't wait to find myself hungry in NoDa again.

So Im going to start by saying I do not like the new menu change in pricing. Thats part of the reason why people would come in. You could have a beer and a meal for six dollars! Where else in charlotte could you do that! And trust me just because the bill was cheap it didnt effect my tipping it made me want to tip the waitress more! Overall its a great place to eat; burgers are great and you can get them cooked however you like. But since you uped the pricing can you atleast have a dollar beer special! PBR or something!

Classic local spot in NODA to drink beer and eat wings. Came after work for happy hour and was pleasantly surprised by the beer selection and the array of Mac and cheese they had. (YOU MUST GET THE MAC AND CHEESE).  I didn't care for the Philly cheesesteak sandwiches but the chili mac was rrreeeeaaaallllyyyyyy ggggoooooooodddddd. I sat outside, which I probably won't do again because of how how hot it was, but a decent  amount of space on the inside. You can bring your furry friend and listen to live music in the back. Great place for cheap eats, beers, and good times.

I arrived at JackBeagle ready for a tasty beer. I love porters; I am a fan of the whole chipotle porter sensation. When I see a beer of this variety available on draft I typically ask for a taste so that I can decide if I would like an entire pour.  I don't need anything more than a drip on my tongue to make up my mind. I found it a bit unnecessary to charge $1 for a taste of this beer. They had Lagunitas IPA so I stuck with an old favorite because I was off put at paying to try the porter. 

The servers were attentive in replenishing beverages outside and the prices for beer were as expected. The patio was nicely heated with plenty of seating. I give JackBeagles the thumbs up and will probably have drinks here again but just can't say it is anything more than average.

An incredible gastropub with a huge patio in the rear just perfect for outdoor summer fun. Mean burgers!!!  Excellent Mac and cheese, and a nice draft list, not too big not too small.   You will not be disappointed.... Enjoy
First time here and this is my kind of dive. I had the "Shit on a stick" (Yes that's it's name) and it was pretty good. Paired with a local beer and the servers are pretty good also

SO FUN. That's exactly what I thought when I breezed through the doors of this place. A mix of peoples, I found a seat immediately and ordered up a dogfishhead pint and gazed at the menu with a small excitement that only comes when I see piles and piles of options for everything. Where to start - the hot dogs which you can get cooked 4 different ways? The Treasure Fries that you can get no less than 8 toppings on?! THERE IS JUST SO MUCH COOL STUFF GOING ON HERE!!!!

The red lighting, exposed brick, small bar, open plan - I love the decor and vibe. The service is quick, friendly and unpretentious ~ and the food? Zing! While they weren't having a great fry night as told to me by the human frymeter that is Tonya, I went with 2 hot dogs and the pasta salad on the side. Hate on me if you will, but I looooove pasta salad and I think it's awesome that this place offers it! It was delish - mayo based with feta, tomatoes, dill and celery. Yum! As for my dogs, I had them smoked with jalepeno relish, chili, slaw and mustard. Boinngggg! I don't even like hot dogs, but these things made me smile big time.

Price wise, this place is ON POINT with my beers, dogs and side coming in at under $11 - I felt like I was ripping good ol' JB off! Will definitely be coming back a lot more now that I know the relaxed, yummy place that awaits across from the sweet NoDa firestation.
the place to be when craving a philly cheesesteak and especially when in noda. or to rip up some paper towels and put them back together like a makeshift puzzle

I'm getting too old lol for such loud noise called music but the food was good no delicious.   Meaty juicy plump wings full of flavor and man the Mac n cheese  was on point.  I went with the basic Mac n cheese but will try other options the next time!  The philly steak sandwich was huge n oh so good! My 17 month old grandson thoroughly enjoyed his Mac n cheese n hot dog!!! 4 adults n 1 toddler and we all gave it thumbs up!  NoDa seems to offer unique but pleasing dining options and this is one of them for sure.   Good prices too!

This place is nice for just sitting on the back porch and NOT ordering anything.  I went here on Wednesday *(the supposedly 1/2 off WINGS - NOT).
We ordered a dozen wings - oh there is an UPCHARGE for everything ! So after deciding what we wanted I told the waiter -  I would like this flavor -- Oh that's an UPCHARGE, to this SIDE which was to be $1 - Oh that an UPCHARGE. This was all told AFTER the fact.... okay so we settled with the non-UPCHARGED items and ordered.  The menu stated the wings come with Celery - nothing about CARROTS! (which I HATE). The WINGS came out all FROST BIT - so dried up and hard it was UN-eatable!  By the way on my way out there was a table of 'OBVIOUS REGULARS' Big Barley Men - unlike petite me - who had FABULOUS FAT, MOIST & MEATY WINGs - so there is the FAVORITISM also!

The waiter also DID NOT GIVE THE WINGS 1/2 OFF!  After all that & having LOUSY DRIED UP NO MEAT on WINGS served to us -- they were NOT EVEN 1/2 off as promised!  They charged us 7.50 for $9.99 - so they don't even know the MATH!

Doubt this place will last long at all if they continue doing business.

To the Owners of Jack Beagles

Here is a thought for them - STOP UPCHARGING things - it's a MARKETING thing that people come in for a special & try one of YOUR specialties... you think they will come back again?! HUH? Instead you give the lousy flavor out of the can chili that was ssooo nasty & Thin & Burnt (nothing like in their viedo of over night soaked potatoes) which were over cooked not -wedged (as I was told they were) French Fries - I would have called them CHIPS not French Fries cuz they looked like Potato chips to me - round cuts cut in half.

Well you should think about marketing and making people WANT to come back but I bet you won't
Pretty good for bar food, I like the area, pretty crowded but quick service. I would come back when in the mood for bar food. The drinks could be better, but decent enough
Some of the best food in noda! If you leave there without getting the mac & cheese you are doing yourself a massive disservice. Pork tacos, turf and turf, and fried mushrooms are worth your time!

Jack Beagles harkens back to NoDa days of old... Before the slick new restaurants and shiny new apartments moved in and gobbled up all the parking spaces. It's a little rough around the edges and grimey but it fills a niche. Enjoyed a few too many beers at Salud and need a little greasy food to sober up? Head to Jack Beagles! Arrive to Haberdish to find a 2-hour wait and want to grab a few drinks while you wait? Head to Jack Beagles! Hung over as hell on Sunday and need some bar grub to bounce back? Head to Jack Beagles!

I try to avoid their draft beers as they always taste a little off. (I'm not sure they clean their lines enough for my admittedly snobby beer tastes.) Good news is they have a ton of bottles and cans. Plus prosecco. You can never go wrong with prosecco. 

They crank out some really good bar food. My favorites include the boneless wings with barbalo sauce and any/all their mac and cheeses. Ted loves their buried treasure fries. I always sneak a few and can't argue with waffle fries covered in cheese, onions, peppers, sausage, etc.
Cool atmosphere. Would make a great Saturday afternoon watering hole to watch a band too. Had a hamburger, all was good.

Quirky hipster bar/restaurant with a great staff and wonderful menu. Had breakfast here. Ended up ordering "Shit On  Shingle" which was awesome. Great country cookin at a friendly place in a cool hood.

I come here quite often...love the breakfast, atmosphere is great in the evening, nice patio (dog friendly), no complaints here!  This will always be my "go to" spot when I want good food, service, and know I won't be disappointed.

The only issue some may find is parking.  If it's busy that's just NODA for you.
What is there not to like about JackBeagles. Great place...great food. I love the grilled chicken grits with jalapeños. Good drinks as well. I will definitely be heading back!

Our favorite Sunday breakfast in CLT. Best gravy (of their biscuits and gravy) you'll find. We've tried several options off their breakfast menu and haven't been disappointed yet. Oh--and the best part? It's ridiculously affordable.
Had mimosas and bloody Mary's and they were no bueno... Food was good but definitely won't order these drinks again.

The energy of this Charlotte restaurant makes you feel like you are in a city. It is a narrow restaurant. There is exposed bricks. It has a good energy that I feel like a lot of Charlotte restaurants are missing.

The outdoor area is fantastic and it looks like they keep adding more to it. There is usually good music.

The food- there is a solid breakfast/brunch crowd. It gets busy. The lunch/dinner menu is good. The hamburgers are juicy and cooked to order. 

The best thing is the Mac and cheese. There is a Mexi Mac type that is especially incredible. 

This place feels like a diner. It has a good, low key vibe. Go.

I didn't eat any food, just drinks...

We were walking around NoDa and were going to stop in one place that we were early for their show and there was a cover, so we walked around for a bit, planning to go back.

We heard music coming from JackBeagles and I was immediately drawn in to their open patio!  

Josh Daniels and Friends were playing and the music was great and so was the singing.  This is very chill and most people were just hanging at the bar.

There are plenty of seats outside though and lots of space to spread out and hang out.

Bathrooms were clean which was nice with that many people around!  I definitely would like to go again.

Excellent service. Cute little place. Nice bar and good drink choices. Their red pepper hummus was incredible and I'm super picky about hummus. The pita bread was nice and fresh, very warm. Highly recommend.

Normally I would rate Jack Beagle's at least 4 stars, but this was a terrible experience. The problem appears to be they are not a breakfast joint. Took 35 minutes to get bacon and eggs and there were only 3 other tables in the place, all of whom already had their food. The server explained they were training kitchen staff. Toast was cold, eggs tasted like they had been cooked in a dirty pan, and the grits, which is the one thing I come here for tasted like instant. Huge disappointment. I guess we will stick with the dinner menu. 

Update: we've been to JB's twice since the lousy breakfast experience and both times were just awful. This place has really gone downhill over the past year. The service is friendly enough but SO SLOOOWWWW! I waited 46 minutes for this last night. It was not a complicated order, and when I asked the sever to check on it after 40 minutes the excuse I was given was "the fries are taking awhile to cook." I told her to ditch the fries and give it to me to go. By the time we left it was 10:00 pm, and I just wanted to leave. So for $11 this is what I got...yea, I got charged extra for the sauce

I will typically try the Mac and cheese wherever I go because, hey, why not?  What I can tell you is that Jack Beagles has the best mac and cheese in town.  With options like Blue Black Mac, Chili Mac, and Mexi Mac, what's not to like?  I've tried nearly all of them at this point and they are all stellar. My favorite though is probably the Blue Black Mac. Their burgers are good but there are definitely better in Charlotte (Cowbell and Kickstand to name a few). 

Not a place that necessarily sticks out in Noda but certainly a good choice for those tired of some of the staples in the area.  I like the fact that this is more of a low key spot where you can relax and grab a good meal. 

Oh, and by the way, they have a nice bar for those looking to grab a beer.

Cheap food? Yes. Good food? Thank you, yes. Dive-y yet hipster atmosphere? Check. Cute guys covered in tattoos behind the counter? Mama, hide'yo kids. 

A friend and I stopped here late night on a Thursday after a show at  Wine Up. We were hungry. They were miraculously still open and serving food. Sometimes a gal just lucks out. 

Steak sub? Get it. I know that's what I'm getting when I go back. Mmm.

This place its indeed one of my favorites in town. I love the rock theme behind it (the music selection is great) and the staff has always been friendly and welcoming each and every single time I have visited. Plus the food... It's extremely DELICIOUS. I had the Patti Melt and also the Chilli Mac N Cheese and each time it just got better, better and better. Plus, I had an ordered of waffle fries with cheese and gravy and lets just say it was delicious in all possible aspects. Anyway, I highly recommend this place to anyone that's stopping by NoDa and its seeking for a great bite.

Am not familiar with Charlotte,so I used Yelp to find a burger. The neighborhood is fun to walk in, the beer selection was ok, decor is industrial chic, Mac & Cheese was slightly above average, burgers were well cooked and tasty, fries were a bit dry. The fried portabella  mushrooms, with the horseradish sauce, are among the best foods I have ever eaten in my life. I live 2 hours from this restaurant and am now considering a road trip just for the mushrooms. Yes, they are that good.
Typical pub food nothing so great price not too bad and server was awesome first time visit but I would definitely try again
Good food, decent beers, nice people, dog friendly. Groovy when there's live music too. Actually, GREAT burgers. And the burgers are antibiotic free, vegie fed cow. Bonus!

Came in right as they opened so it was very empty, they were very friendly and quick. I got the special which was a hoagie sandwich with grilled chicken, pineapple puree, red onions and tomatoes, which was very good and the jack mac as the side and that was amazing. Looks like this would be a great place for drinks as well.

Brunch food was good and mimosas were heavy on the champagne, which I always appreciate. I got the Waco Eggs Benedict. Loved that it was on Texas Toast and the hollandaise was tasty! The dish overall was a little heavy, but that's to be expected. Overall, a solid hungover breakfast place!

Came here on a Sunday morning at 10 am, sat down and ordered quickly. (The Shit on a Shingle and an order of eggs with sausage) The inside was busy--but not slammed by any means, and we watched as couples sat down next to us and received their orders within 10-15 minutes. 20 minutes pass... Still no word. Then 30 minutes.... Our waitress comes up to us and says she "doesn't know what happened" but it "shouldn't be more than a few minutes." Now we are going on 45 minutes, all of the surrounding tables/bar stools have eaten and already left and have been reseated. Our waitress comes up again and gives a pretty insincere apology, saying to us "it should be coming soon, but I don't know if you want to wait any longer or just leave." Since we waited so long, we figured we would give it a few more minutes. Yet another 10 minutes passed... So, hungry and frustrated and without a sincere apology or explanation, we walked out. Not proud of walking out, but an hour of waiting is inexcusable. Guess customer service wasn't a priority this day.

Get the Mac n cheese! It was oh so good and gooey. The perfect comfort food and the price was really good. Got a bowl of the jack Mac and split their dessert which was perfect for Fat Tuesday. Will definitely be returning.

This was one of the best burgers I have had in awhile. I would recommend the black and blue burger.   The beer is cold and cheap enough. Great atmosphere. What else  do you need to know? Stop reading this and go to JackBeagles now!

I have neglected to review Jack Beagles for far too long. To me, this place is practically a NoDa staple these days. I can't even think of NoDa without it coming to mind. Nor can I think of mac and cheese without it coming to mind!

If you're up early you can take advantage of their quick and easy one-page breakfast menu with a selection of specialties, omelets or just a regular old American south breakfast - eggs, sausage or bacon, grits or hashbrowns, toast or biscuits. During the day and into your nightly escapades you can have yourself one of their many delectable [hot] dogs or a choice of 4 or 5 different kinds of mac and cheese. I personally love the Blue-Black Mac with bleu cheese, bacon and cracked pepper. I wouldn't want anybody to forget though: they have a full bar. You name it, they'll pour it. Not to mention a regularly update (practically daily) list of local and unusual brews to partake in.

Foodskis and brewskis aside, the ambiance in here is pretty damn sweet. Yeah, I'll admit it's not top-notch, best place you'll ever sit in, mindgasm level. But it works for a bar. Hell the only improvement would be if the place was a bit bigger. Out back they frequently have live bands even on nights when most places in the neighborhood are slowing down and the patio will be pumpin' as the warmer days roll in. And if it's late out and you're drunkenly stumbling in there's their unmistakable ID checker guy out front on a bar stool as usual waiting to draw a happy smiley face on your hand. A night out in NoDa REQUIRES a stop here.

One of our NoDa favorites.  We have been frequenting JackBeagles for around six months.  Excellent food and cheap beer, oftentimes great beers!  The black and blue burger is my go-to.  Very fresh eats and high quality!  A must eat.

Sometimes it's really hard to find a seat let alone a table, It's always busy in the afternoons no matter what day of the week it is. I like the way the restaurant is split into two, you can either eat inside or you can walk past the double doors in the back and you can eat outside (they have about 3 or 4 TVs out there which is a plus). They occasionally have a band playing in the back during the summer. The food itself is 5 stars, they don't have a huge selection but the food they serve is delicious. If you ever get a chance to go there I recommend the Hawaiian Honey wings, you won't regret it!

This place is quickly becoming one of my favorite bars! I have only been here 3 times and each time has been fun! They have a great selection of beers, friendly neighborhood vibe and almost always are playing awesome music!! The previous times we have came here we sat at the bar and saw the cooks making mac and cheese non stop.. It looked delicious!! So this time (even though I had just finished dinner at Heist) I had to order a small cup. And it was as yummy as it looked!! Next time we are definitely are coming back here to eat!

Jack Beagles is probably one of my favorite watering holes in Charlotte. The entire NoDa area reminds me of home in Seattle. It's artsy and laid back with live bands dotted around.

The staff is always super friendly, the atmosphere is relaxed, and I always manage to meet interesting people here. The drinks are strong and the bar food is yummy. I definitely recommend the wings and the mac 'n cheese. They cook up the pasta, then add things in to toss around in a pan, and the final step is they put it into an oven so the cheese on top melts. If you sit at the bar, you're going to have to order it, because it'll be right in front of your face, calling you. 

The funny thing is that everyone seems to have one item they say you have to try. I've heard so many now that I can't keep track. Go with your gut, your hungry growling gut. It can't go wrong here. Plus, the patio in the back is dog friendly and the music is always great.

Sweet eats. Tasty, well-priced drinks. Friendly service. And overall really good time. What else could you want from a neighborhood bar?! 

Yes, JackBeagles is a grand addition to the NoDa bar & food scene with a comfortable space that will appeal to many. The vibe is laid back but fun and the food affordable but tasty. It is absolutely worth a visit whether you're popping in for a hearty Bloody Mary on a Saturday afternoon or hitting up the bar scene for a late night PBR and hot dog. And don't forget to grab yourself some hot, crispy and delicious fries! They're thin wedges and damn delicious. 

I like me some JackBeagles.

There is a menu section devoted to different types of adult mac n cheeses. Do I even need to say anything else? 

Jack Beagles is a super cool neighborhood bar in the heart of NoDa. Low key atmosphere. Friendly staff. Great prices. Killer tunes. Unique beer selection. Nice patio area. They serve food late night and offer a fantastic breakfast menu on the weekends.

The wings are tremendous. Wednesday is half price wing night and $1 off whiskey. If you're with friends... I recommend hot garlic parmesan. Outstanding. Skip these if you're on a date. Well, unless your sidekick also wants them. Then I guess you can follow the rule of the couple who eats garlic together stays together.

Jacks also serves a mean hot dog. Be sure to get jalapeno relish on it. And don't forget an order of fries. Think thin wedges of heavenly potato goodness. You can also get these buried treasure style... loaded with a laundry list of toppings.

This is a must visit place if you are ever in the NoDa area

Came for the mac and cheese and was a little disappointed. The on tap beer selection is pretty limited, and what else would I drink with mac and cheese?

We split two types of mac between us - the Thai and the pesto. Both were pretty good, but I wish I knew how small the servings were. I actually love that they're more of a snack size because that can be hard to find, but I was expecting it to be dinner. No worries, we ordered some fries to round out our balanced meal.

Overall, I wanted to love JackBeagles more than I did. I live in noda now but I don't know how often I'll be back.
Love that this bar has such great bar food. They never disappoint. One of my favorite places to eat for a low key night in NoDa.

I love everything about this place - from the food to the ambiance to their acceptance of dogs. They have a delicious menu, but the only reason I did not give them 5 stars is because of their terrible service recently. For some reason they have been opening at noon on the weekends, instead of their normal 9am opening time. The staff does not answer the phone or have a voicemail setup that says why they aren't answering and why they aren't opening until noon. I have been trying to eat breakfast here for the past three weeks  and each time we have called ahead to pick up, we have been directed to voicemail or if it was past noon, they say they are no longer serving breakfast (one day we waited THREE HOURS until their noon opening time just to have them tell us breakfast is no longer available - thanks for starving me).

Today, I called three times, no answer. I physically drive to the restaurant and see their handwritten note saying they don't open until noon. I am disappointed that I had to physically see the sign in person to know what is going on. It is frustrating that they are not clear with their customers on their schedule both online (Yelp) and over the phone. 

Jack Beagles staff - please fix this as I've been wanting your breakfast burrito for WEEKS and you guys are preventing me. Thanks.

Once again I really hate a place everyone loves. I can't help it. I went there last night with some friends to get a burger after a show had let out, and we were cold and starving.

Going inside Jack Beagles did not help me out with either of those things.

First it took about 40 minutes to receive our food. Our waitress just sort of stared over at our table wondering what the hell we were still doing there while talking to friends and the bartender. During this 40 minute time period the fans were turned up to such an astronomical speed that in my winter jacket i was freezing to death. We asked our waitress if there was anything to be done and once again she just stared at us like we were the biggest morons to ever grace her presence. We noticed a lot of other patrons becoming really cold too, so it wasn't just me being a baby either. It wasn't until my friend got up and told her we were going to walk out that they finally, oh god, finally turned them off. Oh and then the air conditioning kicked on and blew right onto our table. Thanks guys.

I ordered a burger that was supposed to have cheese, bacon and jalapenos. This burger had so many jalapenos that it was literally just a jalapeno burger. The burger was just this really super weird combination of blandness and burning of my stomach lining. My friend got fries with cheese and gravy. I ate one fry and wanted to die. Not because it was good, but because if that's what passes as gravy these days I no longer wanted to live.
Incredible food for an incredible price. Looks sketchy from the outside but don't let that scare you away- awesome environment and amazing food.

Came here Sunday and the food was great! We just got a few things, two different mac and cheeses, beers and steak dogs! They were delish.  Service was very slow on the patio, specially with us two being partially the only two out there, but was great because I could bring my puppy and she could roam while we ate. I'd definitely return.

I have been here a couple of times since it has opened.  I have to say it is pretty damn good at a nice price.

There are two reasons I gave Jack Beagle's five stars.  

First... good drink specials.  The two times I had gone there they had Dale's Pale Ale for $2.50.  I went there on a Sunday and they had $2 Bloody Marys and Mimosas.  
**EDIT: They raised the price of Bloodys and Mimosas.  They are now 3.50 and 2.50 respectively.  

Second... The best hot dogs in town.  They are smoked hot dogs that can be ordered grilled or fried.  Fried hot dogs do not appeal to me so I went for the grilled.  I ordered one hot dog with chili, slaw, and onions.  The chili they use for the hot dogs is very tasty.  For my second dog I ordered it with a mango chutney and jalapeno relish.  The sweetness of the mango with the spicy of the jalapeno made for a fantastic combination.  Now for the good part... I got two hot dogs and a side of delicious medallion/half-moon shaped fries for about $5 and it is worth it.  

I would like to describe Jack Beagle's as cozy.  Jack Beagles is a small place and does not have a great deal of seating.  I did not get the fastest service but I did not seem to mind.  The server seemed new and by herself so will not be holding it against her or the establishment. 

I also had the wings and cheese-steak.  Both great eats but I would go for the dogs first.

Cozy and laid-back, much like the rest of NoDa. Inside is rather small and gets crowded, but I love the patio! Lots of room, heat lamps during the colder months and live music during the warmer months. 

Food here is wonderful, the waffle fries with gravy are perfect for late night munchies. And their inventive mac n cheeses never disappoint! 

Only downside is that there are only 2 one-room bathrooms, which creates long lines when it's crowded. It's not much worse than a typical bar though, but they're right by the door to the patio so it can get real cramped while you're waiting to go! 

Bathrooms aside, this will continue to be a go-to bar for me as I love the atmosphere, food and the drinks of course!

Great little artsy hole in the wall. The food is great...especially the Mac and cheese. I've tried them all and my fav is the blue black Mac, but you can't go wrong with any of them. 

My hubby is from Philly and this is the ONLY place in town where he's gotten a cheesesteak comparable to home. 

Service could be a bit better and the beer could be a bit colder. I'd also like to see more craft and local beers on special. Other than that...this is a great place to catch some great bar food and hang with friends.
Love jacks... eat here for breakfast and late night! Everything is made fresh and staff is super chill. Good music in the back on warmer days!
Great service and interiors. Absolutely delicious beer with the crunchiest mushroom fries. There, I said it!

Outstanding brunch/breakfast! A lot of food for your money.  I have also had the hotdogs before which were really good too.  Never had bad service. I would definitely go back.  I would definitely recommend trying at least for brunch.

Great food. Cold Brews. Friendly staff. Open late. 

Stugots
Fried Mushrooms
Steak Salad
Blue Burger
Black and Blue Mac

I could eat there 5 days a week.
Okay as a bar and lots of people go here. However the only time I have been it was infested with bar flies!!!  Hopefully this has changed but I won't be back.

This place was amazing! The staff was really nice and attentive and the chef was super nice also. I ordered the Stugot and I could eat that thing over and over! It was the perfect combination of everything! The fries were great also. They have some kind of seasoning sprinkled on top that just makes them good, but after eating my sandwich, which was huge by the way, I was stuffed. I will definitely be back and I'm sure I'll be bringing a group with me!

Such an odd state we live in that a place like this has to serve food as well as beverages - because to me, Jables is about drinking, not eating, and that's just fine, and it isn't just because half the menu is the aptly-named Steak section (in a pinch, us tree-huggers can eat apps - fried mushrooms, bruschetta, etc).

A comfy, orange-and-brick space with beers both adventurous and non, a large, well built bar, good service and few TVs. Tuesdays are half price pints, lovely lovely. Low-key personality and it kinda works.

Sat out in the back patio here. I loved the low key vibe of this place and how easy to was to grab a seat. I had a ripper (hot dog) with slaw and spicy mustard, and a cup of the jack Mac. Hot dog was tasty and delivered my meat fix. I was a bit disappointed by the Mac n cheese though. It was more "liquid-y" than my preference and clearly had not been baked. It was good and I ate it all, but reviews would have me believe it was the best in town. Definitely not the case.  Service was pleasant but very slow, especially for a quiet night.

If I lived in the area I could see coming by here on a whim for a drink and a bite. But as it stands I do not live nearby, and there wasn't anything in particular that would make it a destination for me so I will likely not be back.

Jackbeagles is great! They have such a diverse menu and the best part is that it's super inexpensive. If you are penny pinching and need a cheap meal this is the place to go. 

The hot dogs are done right. You can decorate them however you want. Lots of Mac and cheese options. It's a great bar with great bar food! Try the cheesy garlic bread as a starter. It is perfectly done.

*** I can't review on the food because I didn't eat ***
But we met some friends there around 8pm on a Saturday night. They were sitting out back and having dinner and drinks. The band started playing about 10 minutes later. Once the band started playing, it was to loud to talk to anyone ( which I get is common with bands but it's wasn't pleasant). Our server dropped off waters and then disappeared.  Lastly, I walk up to the bar to order a cider and the bartender was trying to tell me about the different types of ciders they have but, it was so loud I couldn't hear her.  She gave me the one on draft, it came in a little 12oz plastic cup. Once I got the bill, they charged me $6.50 for that little glass of cider.  So in the end, this place is really loud, has bad service, and the drinks are expensive. I won't return.

Ohhhhhh how I wanted to love Jack Beagles. I'd heard good things from friend and read good things on Yelp. So I had really high hopes and I left feeling somewhat underwhelmed. 

Waitress: our waitress was Rivera and she was friendly and fun. We really liked her. She was attentive and super patient in answering all of my questions. 

Drinks: we had mimosas and both thought they were just ok. 

Food: everything was just ok. Nothing was stellar but nothing was terrible. We had the buried treasure, which was pretty good. I had the buffalo chicken wrap and couldn't taste much of the sauce on it. My boyfriend had the stugot cheese steak and described it as "pretty good". We both had macaroni and cheese but were so full we couldn't eat it so it's currently in our fridge. Overall, the food was okay but nothing that I left raving about. 

Service: while we liked our waitress, we were both unimpressed with the time it took for our food to come out. We noticed other tables had quite a long wait for their food as well. Our entire visit took over an hour and a half, which was crazy. 

Will I rush back to this place? Nope. But will I object if a friend wants to go here for dinner? Nah.
we needed a late night drunk meal and ended up here. the burger was okay but nothing special.. the burger came with a HUGE pickle :]
i love the bartenders. i usually come here for a $3 pbr and you can't go wrong with a side of classic mac and the seasoned waffle fries are really good too

First time visiting jackbeagles will definitely come back. 

Got the shit on a shingle breakfast ( no really, it's called that) chopped steak and gravy on Texas toast. Soooo yummy. 

The iced coffee is good too. They have coconut and hazelnut flavor. 

Only reason for 3 stars is that it was 1125 and I wanted lunch but only breakfast served for that time being. Not bad though. Will be back! 

No pics! I forgot!

Very cool and affordable place. I ordered the hummus with pita bread. I liked the hummus but the pita bread was fought. I ordered more bread extra crispy and it still was doughy. My meal was the blue bayou and it was DELICIOUS! I highly recommend it! It doesn't come with a side so you have to pay extra for the waffle fries. So only three stars for the up charge and soft-doughy pita bread. Sunday's have $5 double mimosa ans

What a cool spot in NoDa!!  We ate at the bar cause the place was packed out on a Saturday night.  The chef was in rare form and was very entertaining (the kitchen is sort of behind the bar). They turn out some great food from a tiny little kitchen.  

They had Coco Loco from NoDa Brewing in bottles. yum!  I ordered the cheesesteak and fries.  This was in the top 3 best cheesesteaks I have ever eaten.  The steak especially had excellent flavor.  Peppers and onions were cooked well.  Cheese was correctly portioned so as not to overpower the steak.  Bread was fresh.  Fries were good.

We overheard the staff talking about the live music that was about to start so we moved outside to the patio and grabbed a table. Soon enough the acoustic goodness started.  The outside area was packed as well and so loud that we couldn't hear very well but it was a very nice outside area with additional bar and lots of seating.

I wish this place was in my neighborhood!

There aren't enough great things to say about this place. In lieu of tine and space, ill list a few necessities: 

Ask for Henry - he'll make sure you get a great pour
Order the macncheese - even if your entry is a salad
Come by on Tuesday and play free Bingo and win bar bucks
Go on Wednesdays for 1/2 off wings - Hot Garlic Parm are AMAZING!!
Order any food item - you will LOVE IT!!
Bring your dog and enjoy the patio
Tip well - the folks here work hard to make sure you enjoy your stay!

JB located in the NoDa area is the dive bar of all dive bars. Great bartenders very down to earth & makes great drinks. JB based on some of the locals I've spoken to live by their Mac & Cheese  which comes in different flavors, my fav is the classic which is awesome to say the least. I have to admit that there is A & C squad. From my experience the later it gets the food quality changes. I've come around 12pm on Friday vs 1:30am on a Saturday and ordered the same thing with different results. 

Anyway with all that being said its still an awesome spot and they have events and live music out on the patio. Great group of people and diversity with varying music so a little something for everyone. 

I recommend the Mac and try the wings which are great. The hotdogs and chili are also a fav of  mine. JB also steams their drink glasses which was new for me. Coming from NY, that's not something I've seen in high end bars.

The spot for Mac and Cheese north of center city. Because who doesn't love Mac and Cheese?!? Jackbeagles is a staple of the NoDa community. Tons of food choices including a brunch menu on the weekends. Cheap beer and shots specials. And a solid chance you will catch some live music too. They have outdoor seating available year round and a second bar outside by the stage. 

They don't have a huge area inside so during typical dinner hours there might a short wait to get a table. The folks who work in the kitchen really know what they are doing whether it's a fried hot dog, a huge burger, sandwiches or their famous Mac and Cheese.

Overall expect a solid calm neighborhood feel from this place. They have great specials throughout the week including 50 cent wings and a great invention called the Macarrito. Also plenty of local brews on tap. So go on our and enjoy yourself :)
Hands down my favorite place for delicious ole' pub food! From the Mac N Cheese to the fried mushrooms, you can't go wrong. This is where my lover and I first feel in love!

NODA is on the come up so when a friend suggested dinner there- I said why not! We walked in and it was very intimate but my first thought was this is a def a dive bar. They had a great beer selection but I'm not a beer girl. I drink cider which I know I know is not really beer but it's the closest I can do. But with $1 off whiskey and a good cider the place had me. I had the Classic Beagle medium well and asked for caramelized instead of raw onion. They were happy to oblige. The burger was delicious, it wasn't overlooked, and was quite juicy. The waffle fries were seasoned and quite tasty. Craving a good burger or some hearty food and this is your place. The drinks are good. The music is solid. The staff is very welcoming and the service was great.

Delicous mac n cheese! Food was priced great for the portions you are getting, and they had a great variety with a twist on normal meal items (example, mexi mac n cheese was amazing). Service was great. Live band was awesome to listen to. Would definitely go back.

The French toast was the popular order of our group. The double mimosas were a double surprise and strong so half the group liked it and the other half couldn't hang. The cheese grits were not what I was expecting because it wasn't mixed in, but the worst part is that it was melted on the top and wouldn't mix in with the grits. So I had grits with chunky cheese which didn't taste right. The Classic Beagle was out of this world. Outside of that the rustic warm artistic feel and Irish coffee makes it worth while.

A great spot for lunch or late night munchies!

Classic mac is some of the best mac and cheese you'll find!

So, I was looking forward to returning to Jack Beagle.  I told my husband how good the Turf and Turf Burger was and how that they will give you a portabello mushroom cap on the bun without the beef and bacon.  Well, he ordered it that way and ended up with three mushroom slices on a bun.  He was still hungry after he ate  it and ordered the blue Mac and cheese.  When I ordered the portabello burger with no meat, it came with a side, those delightful waffle fries.  My husband was shorted.
However, I ordered the steak salad.  They had a vegetarian option that substituted portabello mushroom slices for steak.  I also subbed the garlic ranch dressing for the balsamic vinagrette.  With those fried onions and blue cheese crumbles, that had to be one of the best salads I ever had.  I have a feeling though that one portabello cap was shared between my salad and my husband's sandwich.
So, if someone orders the portabello cap with no meat, please give them them the whole cap as the menu clearly states.  They want to have a satisfying meal, too.  Vegetarians don't live on air, and they don't like to be cheated.  
Otherwise, our server was very nice.  And, if my salad wasn't so good,  the rating would have been lower.

Loved this place! Been here twice and twice impressed! A nice little restaurant in the heart of NoDa, with personable employees, great prices, and fast service! 

Their Blue Bayou burger is perfection! Beef patty with bacon and blue cheese crumbles with really amazing sauce! Couldn't have asked for a better juicy and favorful burger! One of the best I've had! 

Their salads are delicious too! I had the BBQ salad, and it was amazing!! The BBQ pulled pork was tenderly cooked and the sauce was absolutely delicious!

If you are fan of mac-n-cheese, they have a selection of adult mac-n-cheeses! You will not be disappointed! 

Definitely a must check out restaurant!

I don't find myself in NoDa enough these days, and after a show at the neighborhood I wasn't going to let the chance to go out slip on by. enter jack beagles... and imagine that, it was whiskey wednesday. 

i clearly fell in love immediately. but the jukebox, the megatouch, the lovely bar space, the option for (good) food, the friendly bartender, the cheap drinks, and the clean bathroom sealed the deal for me. I was actually surprised how many people came in to primarily eat, and then maybe drink. 

great low-key neighborhood feel, I see myself returning to JB fairly soon, most likely in the middle of the week.

Great food, cheap price, great service. What more could you ask for? We stumbled upon this gem Friday night and despite a decent sized crowd, service was quick.

This place features greasy diner food, Northeast style. My friend and I had the rippers, deep fried hotdogs, and they were great, although I am sure that was my recommended calorie intake for the week. 

We both had 2 rippers, fries (which were like really really thick potato chips and delicious), a beer each, and walked out with a $15.50 bill. With so many new restaurants charging more, it is nice to see this spot solidifying itself as the neighborhood hole in the wall.

There was no visible sign out front that I saw. I had to ask the waiter what the name of the place was, hopefully they will work on better branding with their menus/signs in the future. Also, the door guy has no personality and even though I went to the place twice in 1 night, he had no short term memory and kept IDing me. Otherwise, great experience, will definately be heading back in the future (after 5000 sit-ups to cancel out the first visit!)

JackBeagles is inexpensive. They are cheap but so good! Walk right in and seat yourselves... that is, if you can find a spot.

They have a good beer menu that is pretty extensive... any beer drinker can find something that they would like. I think that the prices are fair and comparable for NoDa.

I came here on a night out with the boyfriend. Try all of the mac and cheeses.... they are so good. I also ordered a burger that I cannot remember. It was average. 

There was music playing in the background and a great overall vibe. Service was just decent but I know she was hustling. I would definitely recommend this spot while at a night out in NoDa- who doesn't love cheap food, good beer, and a great atmosphere?
Atmosphere is very chill and unpretentious, which is nice when you're not in the mood for a night uptown. Great service and above average pub food. Try the mac and cheese..any of them.
I think I'm a regular now. The food is delish and the atmosphere is great. Such a great hangout spot.
Food was extremely good & inexpensive.. only to hung I hated was, my food all came out separately.. like 15-20 min in between each entree

You want a nice, belly up, NO DA bar?  This is a good choice.  We wandering in during a cold snap and were greeted cheerfully by a saucy bartender.   She gave us some good talk on the specials and had us sold.      

They had a couple beers on tap that I hadn't tried yet and it being Wednesday we lucked into their wings special.

If you like a hot-bqq ( like a sweat and hot) wing, then get the "Barbalo" sauce. It was good. It left zinging taste in my mouth, but not to hot or vinegary for the lips.

well-- JB's used to be my favorite-- but then they changed their fries!!! it truly was the worst decision they could have made! their "beagle fries" were the best things ever-- that's what kept my friends and i coming back.. now it's just plain old waffle fries with some scarce seasoning on them. blah.

BRING BACK THE BEAGLE FRIES!!!
Came for breakfast. The breakfast tacos with hollandaise are awesome!

Sunday mornings are better at Jack Beagle's. I normally get their SOS with a bloody Mary. If you're not there for brunch, I think their blue bayou burger is the best burger in town. Get it with blue-black mac or jack-mac.

What is it about NoDa that springs to life such great places as Crepe Cellar, Revolution Pizza, Solstice, and now Jack Beagle's.  Is it the water?  Is there something in the air (no, not THAT something)?  Whatever it might be it's responsible for another great place in a great neighborhood.

I've been to Jack Beagle's twice now, both evening visits, and it was a great experience on each occasion.  Their beer list is distinct, and apparently ever evolving as the list on the menu was the same both times but what was on tap didn't necessarily match up, including beers like Abita Select (a vanilla porter) that I haven't seen anywhere else around town.  Along with the snooty stuff I like they keep a selection of the yellow fizzy stuff around to keep that crowd happy as well.

The menu...it's interesting, in a cool awesome way.  Great hot dogs are available any number of ways, including deep fried (not battered like a corn dog, just to dog boiled in oil basically).  And the potato wedge-fry things are the side to get.  Great tasting and they do get at soaking up the extra alcohol from the previously mentioned beer selection.

Head to NoDa and give Jack Beagle's a try, totally worth the trip!

Great food during the day and staff is prompt and friendly for a bar. Night time gets much more busy but service has still been great. The live music is always awesome and their outside venue is awesome with beautiful weather.   Great place, relaxed atmosphere. 

Doorman at night is super nice and cool.

Though I frequent the NoDa neighborhood a few times per month, this was my first time visiting JackBeagles. My friends and I came here after the Parkway Drive concert at the Fillmore. We were famished after all the moshing and head banging and needed food in our belly to soak up the overpriced alcohol and sober up a bit before heading back home (don't worry, we had a DD).

Each of my friends ordered the Philly cheesesteak. One even ordered it with cheese whiz (ugh... just... no). I, however, strayed from the pack and ordered a basket of fried mushrooms and a cup of chili mac. The fried mushrooms were thinly sliced portabellas, lightly breaded, and fried golden. While it was good, I'm not sure I would order it again. The chili mac was made with your typical elbow macaroni and cheddar cheese, but what elevated the dish was the savory, sweet, and slightly spicy chili. 

There were no complaints from anyone in our group. We left with our bellies full and smiles on our faces.

I love the divey atmosphere of this little restaurant. The staff was very amiable, especially our server, Ryan. My opinion of this place may be skewed even more favorably since Ryan comped half my meal without me knowing. JackBeagles was a great ending to our amazing night. There's simply no wrong choice with anything on the menu so give this place a visit if you're in the NoDa area.

We came here after work one day and wasn't too impressed with what we found. We sat at the bar hoping we could get a couple of drinks in. Wednesday's was $1 off whiskey and half off wings, deals we thought would be pretty good. I ordered a fireball  just to gauge prices, and including the discount it was $5...eh not that great since I get $3 fireballs from on the border...

The bar tender took forever to notice us..I literally had to stare her down to get her to come over. She was nice, just not attentive. We ordered a bowl of jack mac, they have 4 different kinds of mac and cheese options with some twists. I can't help myself when it comes to mac so I had to order a bowl to split with the bf. In light of the half of wing wednesdays we ordered a 10pc with hot garlic parm and the spicy mango habanero equivalent. 

Didn't take long to come out, that was probably the biggest plus of our meal. The mac and cheese bowl looked like the cup size...seriously tiny and not worth the $6...it had good flavor not amazing and no texture...I wouldn't call this adult mac and cheese. Maybe I just spoil myself with the mac I make at home with all the fixins thrown in. The wings, celery sticks and carrots were sad, soggy and lukewarm...I am 99% sure they were frozen though the website seems to claim otherwise. The flavor of the sauces was good though the mango habanero was NOT SPICY at all...I just wished the quality of the wings and sides were just as good...BWW does wings way better in my opinion..

In addition, the wings were not really half off...they docked on extra 2 dollars because we ordered two different sauces...which is lame. We had an ok experience but I doubt we will be coming back for after work munchies..

Jack beagles is my go to in Noda. The have something to please everyone day or night. 
Typical bar food options that are good and affordable! Brunch is pretty solid as well!

They have great daily drink specials, which makes it a great place to please everyone and often have live music.
One of the best Mac and cheese dishes in Charlotte! And the bartenders are awesome too!
Great macaroni and cheese selection, I went with the blue thought it was exceptional.  Also great hot dogs!

Amazing. Cheap drink specials with a full bar, delicious food options and live music. Great outdoor patio space with an additional bar. Highly recommend any of the rippers with Mac-and-cheese. Prices are incredibly low for the quality of food you receive.

Great Place!!

Jack Beagles has a great dive feeling, more of a bar style than full on restaurant in the evening, however I have also been here for brunch and the food is swell! 

Best Tip about this place: bring your doggie!!

A hole in the wall with crazy good mac and cheese.

It looks like a dive bar, it smells like a dive bar, the bathrooms are a dive bar's, the service is a dive bars... the food is incredible! Best drunk food I have ever had. I need to try all the mac and cheeses.

The food here is tasty, I could smell it from a block away, I believe I had the Garlic & Parmesan Hot Wings and fries, which where one of the best wings I've ever had, there's also a fairly big patio out back where you can eat and have you a smoke. The waitress was super friendly and very helpful with my order, being it was my first time there, the only downside is the one bathroom for the ladies and one for the men, so if you gotta go, I suggest u not try to hold it and hope there's not a line, but all in all the food and atmosphere here is great, and I will definitely visit again.
waffle fries and chicken fingers. what else could you ever need? oh, booze. tons of booze. this place is my favorite spot in NODA
They have by far the best macaroni and cheese, every type you could think of they have. Plus they always have great beer specials and drink specials. Must go to

Having a beagle  myself for parts of my life, I had to check this place out and I'm glad I did. The attention to detail which is so important and many don't have Jack beagles does! Can't wait to go back
They make the best mac and cheese ever. I'd recommend ordering the Thai Mac and cheese. Burgers are really good too and the staff is solid.

A fun local NoDa joint with 6 tables and a bar, serving hand smoked rib wraps with blue cheese coleslaw and a great beer list. The service was great, and friendly ("Hi we're Erin and Laura and we'll be taking care of you.") and the decore fun ( local art). I was here for lunch, but I'll bet it's filled at night.

Our first stop for grub in Charlotte and let me tell you this place did not disappoint! Our valet at the hotel told us to check this out and I can't thank him enough!
I love it when the server is a fan! You can tell right away if they like working there and more importantly eating there. I often ask...what's your favorite thing here and when they know right off the bat and their giddy about it that is a good sign! Mel was a fan! 

We started with waffle cheese fries - loaded with chili, cheese and peppers! Oh dear Lord! Then we went on two orders of Mac n Cheese - they have such a selection! We asked Mel and she said the Blue Cheese with Bacon and the one with garlic so we listened and so glad we did! Damn they were both good! The blue with bacon was the best though! Then...yes we continued...boneless wings with the sauce that had both BBQ and wing sauce combined. Can't remember the name but ask Mel! 

Oh and I almost forgot. I got a blueberry beer that wS on tap...still looking for something similar! So refreshing and light! The hubs went for a local beer "Birdsong Brewing Company" brown ale. 

Just go...the end! Oh and ask for Mel!!!

Perfect small Dive-y bar.  Why you may ask? Let's check the "Perfect small Dive-y Bar checklist."

Small - check
Great Food - check
Locals in and out all the time - check
Patio - check
TV - check
Local art - check
Great Beers - check
Breakfast - check
Late night service - check
Fun staff - check

There is no arguing, Charlotte needs more Beagles.

Went for breakfast. I had high hopes based on a friends recommendation BUT Like most breakfast spots in CLT this place is average at best. Sat at the bar. Service wasn't great even though they weren't that busy. Gf had the basic breakfast and I ordered the burrito. I just don't understand why there isn't a decent breakfast to be had in CLT. A bad breakfast in Asheville is better that most in CLT.

Get the jack Mac, very good. Went for lunch. (Get the bowl if you're hungry.)

Definitely go back.

Had my first litte rendezvous with JackBeagles yesterday, and my, my, my was I impressed.

I found myself at JackBeagles in the company of a certain spectacular photographer ;) and the kind owner of this flavorful establishment. Inside, JB's offers cute and cozy bar setting with additional setting in house and out on the patio.

The patio offers a friendly escape from your typical dining environment, and a pretty sweet view! I Likey =) Encompassed by a few tall trees and tiki torches there's just enough light, just enough ambient sound, and the right combination of company that made for an almost vacational dining experience. The patio gives guests the perfect combination of feeling included in the restaurant atmosphere and simultaneously offers seclusion from it, an interesting combination and so amazing!

On to the eats! By recommendation I tried one of the delicious hot-dogs. My toppings of choice.. Cheese Of Course! (And ketchup, and mustard) Let me tell you that my hot dog was so delicious and juicy, it was like Nicolas Cage ... Gone in 60 seconds! And the fries, oh the FRIES! In a word.." mmmmmm". Yup that's right, "mmmmmm." No word's necessary, just my delicious and satisfied sound. These fries are the perfect combination of real potato crisp and salt. The fries were soo good I could eat them without ketchup! Gasp! 

I look forward to my next visit at JackBeagles. I'll definitely be back to taste a few spirits, and take a bite out of one of JackBeagles fried hot dogs. Mmmm! That is all for now, keep up the great work JackBeagles!

After spending two nights in downtown Charlotte, we decided to see what this NoDa thing and JackBeagles were all about before we headed back to Raleigh.  (thanks to Yelp for letting us know about both). I will say that getting to NoDa was interesting, as our GPS led us first to a street that was totally closed off, then to one that made us wait for the longest slowest-moving train on the planet.  But it was all just a plot to make sure we didn't have to wait more than 3 minutes for JackBeagles to open at precisely 11:30 on a Monday morning.

We weren't the only ones waiting, and within minutes of opening, 4 or 5 tables were full.  Server handled it all well.  Drinks came out fast.  Sadly, we were hitting the road, so we didn't partake in brew offerings.  Love that they have cup sizes of the different Mac n Cheeses, enabling me to try a couple of them...Jack Mac and Mexi Mac at just $2.99 each!  Husband did the Reading Street Steak Sandwich, which  involved mushrooms and tomato.  

Note:  this isn't already-prepared Mac 'n Cheese...you can see them make it to order!  Both of mine were rich and delicious in an under-stated way.  I enjoy a cheesy Mac n Cheese, as compared to a baked kind, and that is what they deliver.  For the Jack Mac, think cheese with a Frank's Red Hot kinda subtle undertone.  Mexi-Mac had some green chiles of some type in a subtle way as well.  Liked them both equally well, and thanks to their richness, got to enjoy them again the next day.

Meanwhile Husband was liking his sandwich and fries. Although he did say he thought it could have used more seasoning.  No leftovers for him though, that's for sure.

Price-wise...very reasonable!

TIP:  Check-out the cute pic on the restroom door!

I was looking for a place that was open after 11pm. This place looks good as I came in and the pics looked good. The waitress was really nice young girl. The happy hour drinks are. 5$ for Red Bull and vodka. It was good and the fried hot dog  was good but they gave my sliced cheap kraft cheese and the hot dog and the hot dog was burnt. 
I ordered the cheese Parmesan with there special
Sauce it was horrible I sent it back I Literally almost threw up.
Be cautious

Wings and mac and cheese. Done!  - That should be enough to get you through the door, right? 

If you're confused as to where this NoDa gem is located... look for Cabo and it's on the opposite end of the same block. As expected, parking is at your own risks, so find somewhere and walk on over to join the crowd. The food will put an end to any complaints in the event you're just a passenger. 

At first glance, the place seems small and you're probably looking around to see where you can wait for an open table. The hidden treasure is the back patio with a second full bar. The patio has more TVs and larger tables for larger groups, but you may need a coat once the temperature drops. 

Luckily, a few chairs opened up at the first bar so my friends and I were able to grab a spot and quickly order our drinks. There were a few specials available, so be sure to check the (lighted) list to the left of the bar before placing an order. We were informed that the kitchen was running behind, so our food would take a little longer than normal. I always appreciate a heads up before making my food order, if the kitchen is running behind, so the bartender was already turning into my best friend. 

After ordering a dozen wings I was pleased to see that they weren't tiny wings that some pubs like to offer and if I must say... give the Cajun and Jack's Hot Garlic Parmesan a try, thank me later. The only setback was the fact that I smelled like I'd been cooking the food myself, as sitting at the bar resulted in my jacket smelling like french fries upon my departure. However, that's not enough to keep me from this place. 

Hope you take part in all the mac and cheese options they have to offer!!

Yes it's a bar and yes it's surrounded by other bars, but it is by far my favorite drinking hole.  Almost every night is started here because of the friendly bartenders and the well priced drinks and beer. 

But the most shocking factor of JackBeagles is there phenomenal food offering. They're hot dogs and macaroni and cheese cannot be compared to any other in the Noda area. And because they serve breakfast, it's a great place to roll out of bed for on Sunday mornings.

Cool place to hang out on a day off...!  Great hot dogs and the beer line-up was very tempting. Next time...

Fries were ok but the mac & cheese was spectacular. Next time I'll skip the fries.  Not many vegetarian options - even the mac & cheese had bacon. 

The patio out back is great for big groups of friends and it has a stage for bands. 

Thanks, Yelp, for finding this great place!
